Seriously. Don't. I could not believe how anyone with a soul would want to publish this. It would make fucking Hannibal Lector rip out his own liver and eat it.

Oh, boy, where do I even begin…? The fact that this has spanned two seasons so far (also fondly known as half a day I’ll never get back) is honestly appalling. If you enjoy watching female MCs being borderline sexually assaulted, then by all means, this is the show for you. But otherwise, spare your mind and your eyes and don't be fooled by this travesty.
This is a reverse harem anime, so it comes as no surprise just how often Diabolik Lovers sends the watcher down the sexually-suggestive-with-hints-of-sadism rabbit hole. The very first episode has no qualms about shoving it into your face as soonas the poor girl enters the mansion, and things don’t taper out much in the first season… or the second season, for that matter. 


Of course, in terms of plot, there really isn't one; just one huge convoluted mess of bite scenes—okay, a lot of bite scenes—in which the dialogue during said moments tends to be… well, uncomfortable to sit through. Also, can we talk about the sound effects? Since when does biting into flesh sound anything like eating an apple? And don’t even get me started on the actual blood sucking. It literally sounds like the voice actors sat in the studio slurping a can of goddamn Progresso over their microphones.


The characters aren't much better. Yui Komori is the incredibly mundane MC who allows herself to be walked all over by the boys at every turn. I get it, they're vampires, and could probably overpower her. But goodness gracious, couldn't she have tried a little harder? The Sakamaki boys even told her to get out while she could, but no, the twat couldn't even manage to do that.  Sure, the boys may be pretty (and maybe you’re reading this thinking that you’d be fine with it all because they are such eye candy) but good God, are they assholes, and the fact that Yui just… lets them be like that is beyond irritating. No one likes watching a show where they want to repeatedly slam a metal chair into the main character’s head. Okay, actually, that was rather violent imagery, so just ignore that. 


The art is... not great, not terrible, but decent, I guess. Yui's eyes are weird as hell, but the boys actually aren't terrible looking. At the end of the day, maybe that's the only reason to watch this trainwreck. And the music isn't half bad... the OP is pretty catchy, and the ED music helps set a tone much darker than  the story actually is. 


— Overall Rating: 2/10

— Pros: Attractive characters (though this does not equal good art); Japanese seiyuus did a proportionately better job than the American ones; that's it, that's all I can think of

— Cons: Many, many plot holes (the show is basically one big plot hole); art is pretty mediocre; MC has no redeeming qualities; cheesy and over-the-top dub acting; extremely short episode time (though for me it meant less time writhing in mental anguish); forgettable soundtrack.

I hate verbal abuse with a fiery passion. I feel like no girl should EVER be degraded in such a way that the protagonist was by the men - or I should say vampires - surrounding her. What made it even worse is that she didn't try hard enough to stop them, and when they weren't harassing them, she went on being friendly to them as if they weren't just shooting the nastiest words they could come up with her way. It was as if she didn't mind at all what they were saying to her, and I'm surprised she didn't just straight up saysomething like, "Oh yes! Degrade me more!" 


Never in my life did I imagine to be watching something so brutal - and I'm not speaking on terms of violence. This anime is definitely geared towards the community's masochists because I simply cannot understand how anyone else would remotely ENJOY it. I came so close to dropping the show all together so many times I lost count. The ONLY thing that made me happy that I watched this short anime all the way through was the little, little, LITTLE character development that I was so thankful for.  


The best thing this show could possibly offer was probably the fact that the vampires were extremely attractive and the theme song was really good. I really enjoyed the tune of it. Also, the full version has sequences where the singers are whispering into each of your ears (if you use headphones). Although, given the name is "Mr. Sadistic Night" and if I were to look up the translated lyrics, I'd probably come to hate it because I'm almost one hundred percent sure the singers - AKA the voices of Ayato and Shuu - are saying some pretty nasty things. 


If you are like me and don't like when women are constantly being bashed down, spare yourself the pain and go find another show like Fruits Basket or something. If you're a fan of this kind of thing, go right ahead.

I can't believed I watched the whole thing... 
A friend recommended me this anime. I gave it a shot but that was a mistake...
 What bothers me the most is the characters: The main girl Yui, she's one dimensional, passive and helpless. The Vampire guys... ugh, there’s nothing unique about them! In fact, they're almost the same: they're perverted and sadistic and that's all it is! I mean all they do for almost every episode is assaulting her and sucking her blood. Nothing of substance here. 
 I feel that this anime is aimed at those who are into masochism. If you're no into thatsort of thing, then this anime isn't worth your time, it's anything but romantic.

*CONTAINS SPOILER *
 This anime series grasped my attention when I saw the game series first, it looked okay and enjoyable in the game. Very fun games to play! VISUAL NOVELS
Young girl, Yui, is taken into a house full of boys, due to circumstances. Then the obvious they are all going after her, but instead they are all after her blood, since they are sadist vampires. Yay. 
It was very cliche from the start to the end. I could predict how it would end. The character development was so poor, they gave it all away on the first episode? Crazy brother, smart brother, pervert brother,narcissist brother, reserved brother. This is pretty common especially in reverse harem, no fault there. 


The plot was so mediocre. Within time Yui will become something she isnt, and it must be stopped. 



 In the Manga series and visual novels, they have many scenes where the characters express themselves, have a deep talk, & you can see a connection. You can see how each brother built up to who they are now, what is happening in the present, & many more feelings.  It would of been a 7 or 6 overall for a reverse harem novel in my list! 



BUT NO! This was just bad. Yui was constantly bitten by every brother, annoying whining and defenseless persona. Constantly molested and insulted. And overall just had a very rushed plot.


I had hopes, since romance, reverse harems can be enjoyable, but this just not it. Season 2 is coming. I'm curious how that one will start or end. I hope they make it more like the manga or visual novel honestly.

Pathetic! Just pathetic in every single category. I felt the need to post a review because I am done with it! I'll just read about it on the wiki to see how it ends but I am not watching anymore of this train wreck of an anime!
What really bothered me the most was the nickname that Raito guy kept calling her. She doesn't question THAT nickname, but Ayato gives her a nickname based on her bust and she wants to her open her mouth about it? Are you serious?
And that guy with the bear, what is his deal? Freaking weird!
Really the story and the episodedid not flow together, out of nowhere she wants to ask the eldest brother a serious question and yet there were never any thoughts of her wanting to know or being interesting in knowing the brothers at all.\n\n
Her personalty is just awful! So awful, she would win the award hands down! I mean she will protest, though not strongly or hard enough, about the harassment she is getting, and yet she stays and just goes with them and whatever they want. I just can't watch anymore. This fifteen minute train wreck is just a waste of time!

There are two reasons why this anime is good.
Then there are two reasons why this anime is bad. 
Let’s get the difficult part out of the way: why is this anime good? Its art is good and its good material for masochistic, vampire, reverse harem loving fans.
Let me explain:
Anyone who tells you that the boys are hot in this anime……… are not wrong, with the exception of one (yes those who have watched it you know who I’m talking about- the teady bear one). For the large majority I can see why the boy’s designs would appeal to a certain audience. (Personally the more Ilook at it, the less I feel for it, not that there was much to begin with)

A colour scheme that is befitting of the dark “love” that these vampires portray, if nothing else (and yes there is nothing else) then at least it’s a good show to look at.

I’m going to put some quotes on here as to what some fans said about why they enjoyed the show:

>>>‘Diabolik lovers is the first anime I've ever watched and I loved it  (oh I feel seriously bad for this girl)

Reasons why -

They are vampires 

There hot  (Grammar -_- just saying!)

They all have different personalities

The way they dress 

And you can fall in love with each one (questionable but ok)’ 

>>>>‘I like the game and the anime..

Mainly because of Shu and Ayato and.. earphone / cool / bad boy type guy. omfg. I forgot my own bae's name.

faints’ (For every person using the word bae out there>)

>>>‘the only reason I watched it was because they’re hot’ (pretty much the only reason to watch it at all)

Been there, had that mindset, done that, now regretting it XD 


Moving along reason no.2! Aside from one or two reverse harem, not one reverse harem comes to mind that I have given a score higher than 6 or 7. Adapted from an otome game you can already tell what’s going to happen.

Listing. Lots of it.

If you’re watching this and enjoying it, then you’re likely a masochist, or a sadist. It’ll easily appeal to those who prefer the darker side of “love” and the different scenarios they come up with in which his (multiple ones of course) fangs and her neck will end up connecting. And yeah…….um that’s about all I can say.

And yes that is love in speech marks. For everyone saying that it’s romantic -_-………….


Now for the easy part of the review. Why was it bad? Two reasons-character design and plot. 

The first time I watched this, I gave the show a 5. I like assertive men, just not abusive ones. It was a bad period, and what I hoped would be an anime to cheer me up-sadly did quite the opposite. I was left feeling bored, but also with a niggling feeling that something about this anime wasn't right. 

Then I dared to re watch it again after having become acquainted with decent anime, and actually took a few moments to pause and think. The result I re evaluated it to be a 3. The characters are all pervs, pushy, and to be blunt straight up abusive.

No matter which way you look at it, this isn’t seduction, romance or beguiling or whatever fancy word you want to use to describe it.

This is a fight over food.

And the one who’s food is the female protagonist. 

Whilst some of the characters MAY have appealed to me if it wasn’t just that there were so 2D and repetitive. 

In reality-as “diverse” as these characters may appear to be, they all actually have the same personality with slight tweaks, and I’m going to take a shot at the art as well. The same applies to the art. Initially seemingly different appearances suddenly merge and voila you get the same character.

OK let’s go independent on these characters:


Shu-headphones dude, (reference to quotes above) has an appearance for maybe two episodes? Guess what I don’t care. Probably the least douchiest out of the brothers, but then again that’s not really saying much.


Reiji-seemingly the only polite one in the brothers and sane one, but you know what they say. The quiet ones are usually the craziest 0.0


Ayato- OK seriously what is up with his trousers, why just one? Why not both of them? Seriously shorts or trousers, PICK ONE NOT BOTH. (it doesn’t really irk me but I find it hilarious with this clothes design-is this a new trend? Am I out of the loop and if I am, I DON'T WANT IN) oh and you want mixed signals this guy gives them, and then on top has the irk to be annoyed with her XD Dude is messed up


Raito-winner of the most awkward laugh ever. Oh and his “playful” nickname for her got boring after the first time he used it *yawns* sad attempt at being a badass, but full marks for being  a huge douche


Kanato-get the kid a therapist, or a sedative. Probably the closet to a likeable character ‘I’ll break you’ that was a good line. However a few episodes along, guess what? The protagonist goes along with him. To a graveyard. Alone. In the dark. I’ll get back to you when my mind has stopped exploding


Yui-last one-he gives her a knife to kill him with. Now whether this makes me like him or think he’s insane I’m unsure.

Also props to the heroine for doing the clever thing and not stabbing that F**** through the heart right there and then -_-


If you want badass, and a good vampire character? 

I suggest a 180 turn for you cause this anime ain’t got them. They’ll give you annoying, uncomfortably trying too hard, pretty boys.

The words creepy, may factor into this anime, just not the kind of creepy that’s good or appealing. The kind of creepy you whip your rape whistle out for. 


Examples of good vampire characters: Alucurd (duh) and Dio from Jojo’s Bizarre Adventures. 

Again refer to the drinking rule games to understand what the majority of this show is about, and the general character designs.

As for the female protagonist? Weak, spineless, constantly in denial, dumb, can’t assert herself, generic and boring. 

I would use more words, but then I might come across as excessive. (I’m not she really is quite irritating)

I doubt even in the fandom you’ll find a fan who’ll say oh her! I actually really liked her.


Plot. There is no plot. IT’S AN OTOME GAME. I won’t deny there have been some good adaptations, although it’s difficult to deny that the overwhelming majority haven’t. 

And whilst I may not have had high hopes for a particularly intelligent anime, what I was not expecting was an ending so rushed, so blatantly squeezed in, and so confusing that it would have left me with a headache. The problem with the ending? They tried to put plot in when they had already wasted a good 11 episodes having ignored that. So aside from being bored, annoyed, I also had a headache when I finished this. -_- tell my again why I should have enjoyed this anime?


I watch anime with the policy that I should watch all regardless of genre, reviews, art style and synopsis etc. And I always recommend that other anime fans follow the same policy. Even watching the bad ones will allow you to distinguish between what’s good and what’s bad.

Nu uh. Not this anime.

I will definitely NOT be watching a second season of this show; at least not without a bottle of coke, or vodka depending on how extreme it is. I am only recommending this anime on the basis that if you’re seriously out of drinking games, (take a shot every time she's called bitch chan, man handled, calls for help, licked or bitten) and you do have anime fan friends around, take a shot at this (pun intened) and see how many episode you can watch before you feel ill. (Even with or without drinking)

Surprisingly, I clocked this anime with hope that it would get better but alas I was fully let down. 
The synopsis cleverly obscures the true colours of this total disaster of an anime which is a girl thrown into a den full of sadistic vampires that all seem to be irrevocably obsessed with her blood. The plot gives off the assumption that it has some sort of romance however it is substituted for the vampires' meaningless attraction to her blood. 
The words "draining experience" as quoted from the synopsis have a literal meaning to them. Unless you're okay with hearing ghastly sucking/slurping noises when Yuigets her blood sucked out of her then I highly recommend you mute the sound. Unfortunately, this happens quite frequently throughout the whole anime as she gets her blood drained/sucked about a million times an episode so you might as well watch the full 12 episodes (if you can even make it that far) soundless. The music is not worth mentioning as I can hardly remember it.


The characters were like cardboard - bland and empty. There is hardly a background behind the vampires however I would say Ayato had the most development. One thing they all have in common is the fact that they're rapists and sadistic as hell. The mc (Yui) is the most useless, pitiful and weakest character ever. She succumbs to the group of vampires with the same pathetic and inoperative fight every time she gets approached by one of the boys and seems sincerely surprised when they suck her blood even though it happens all the bloody time. Hence this lead me to the conclusion that Yui is secretly a masochist and enjoys getting her blood sucked out of her (lol what a dumb girl). None of the characters are particularly likeable as they are all quite dreadful and have no interesting attributes. 


Like many other people, I was attracted to this anime by its art which I thought was actually quite nice. The vampires' hair had pretty hues and Yui generally looked quite winsome unless she was getting her blood sucked ha ha. However, most of the anime was enclosed in a sense of darkness which reinforced the idea of rape thus the art was a turn off for me in the end as well as everything else. 


Hence, unless you have an abundance of time to screw around then don't watch this lmao. Although, it isn't quite hard to clock this anime since the eps are 15 minutes, I don't recommend it because your life will never be the same again (tfw when you watch a real crap anime) like how did this even get a second season?


This was my first review ahh, k bye

This anime was complete garbage, I don't usually write reviews but with this one, giving it a score of 1(Appalling) just isn't enough. The story has no plot, the heroine has no personality and the boys have no good points. Lots of abuse and rape themes and I would much rather watch every episode of Bobobo-bo Bo-bobo dubbed than waste another 15 or so minutes on one single episode of this heaping pile of trash

I really wanted to give this anime a good score, but I can't. There is no way, I can possibly do it.
When it comes to "reverse harem" anime, you know before hand that plot won't be the strongest point, as well as the Heroine. You can guess that with 99.9% possibility she'll be submissive...more like devoted masochist, hopefully just  silly, but in reality, plain stupid airhead with pure heart and zero precaution.
So we have it all here. But what makes this anime worse than others? How should I say it....Although, I said that RHA' plot not it's strongest point...at least it does exist..Here...I doubt.*on the second thought* Ok-ok....Mayyyyybe....it does exist, but(!) because of episodes' duration you can't say it for sure. Only a very skilful writer can fully disclose the story in such short time. Sadly enough, the story itself is, frankly speaking, mediocre and 15 minutes per episode simply killing it.\n
This whole thing is a"live version"  of otome game. But, trust me, you can play it and get more joy and satisfaction than from watching this anime.\n
From the very beginning male characters are popping out of nowhere(almost literally), declaring their rights on Female and, while giving her mental or physical torture somehow develop THE FEELING. \n
What makes it worse, there is no escape. From one male character to another..from one torture to another...They are all jerks. It's a masochist's paradise! I get it..it's a concept...but it's suffocating.\n
All 12 episodes you have to watch the Heroine, being treated like an object, a thing...and what makes it even worse she gladly accepts it. I guess, when it comes to game you can tolerate it to the certain level, cause, in the beginning you choose your "Prince Charming" and all you do is dealing with him. But here it's  not one, but 6 at once! \n
 Male characters are stereotypical, we have: vulgar and narcissistic alpha-jerk; perverted playboy; little yandere; lazy and laid-back a.k.a the mysterious one ; cool and strict with glasses; delinquent, probably, tsundere(?). But they are also sadists...and vampires.\n
What's good here? Well, Art is decent...and Music....is not bad either.\n
In the end..well, if you've got nothing to do, than you've come to the right place, otherwise....you won't lose anything if you skip this stuff.

[NOTE: Before I get into this review I feel that it is imperative to note that I am of the target audience for this anime (young woman, previous player of the games, masochistic...), and so my overall enjoyment may differ from other viewers. However, I will try to keep this review as open and honest as possible.]
Diabolik Lovers is no doubt one of the most hated anime of the Reverse Harem genre, and it shows. With characters which seem to show little to no regard for the heroine's basic human rights, wants or needs, are unable to differentiate between romance and sexual harassment, and appearpretty much the furthest things possible from decent human beings, what could possibly redeem it in a genre where characters are meant to be lovable? To start, the fact that they are, of course, NOT human, and are in fact vampires of a noble bloodline, with complex backstories that influence their current behaviour, and genuinely no clue of how to treat a human being with care or consideration, something which the anime adaption fell significantly short of delivering.


Now, I don’t want this review to turn into a constant, direct comparison of the source material, but I feel it is necessary to bring it up often when explaining the psychology of Diabolik Lovers, its characters, and its audience.


Story - 3/10

It is no secret to anyone who watches this that the story is just not there. We initially have very little clue as to why the heroine is suddenly thrust into this dangerous, reverse-harem-typical setting bar “dad told me to do it”, and the show’s later attempts at weaving in subtle hints, or attempting to drop full-on dramatic plot bombs, just aren’t up to standard. It also attempts to follow, yet again, the genre-typical ‘every boy gets an episode’ structure, which sometimes works in the plot’s favour, and very often doesn't. This case is one of the latter. It’s a true disappointment to see the characters that had their own detailed story-line and iconic moments in the source material reduced to some edgy flashbacks and cringy sexual harassment, played off as normal behaviour as opposed to a psychological assault.


The anime attempts to amalgamate the main plot (that was originally covered in 6+ character routes) into 3 or 4 episodes at the end. You can see where that’s going. If you like any other aspects, the second season attempts to salvage what we lost in plot satisfaction here, so...there’s that.


Art - 5/10

Character art is pretty most of the time, which is no surprise for a bishounen reverse harem. There are a few derpy moments, but you get a laugh out of it. Background work is mostly nice, however animation is inconsistent.


Sound - 9/10

In my mind, probably the most redeeming factor. The VA cast is solid, and played their roles almost as fabulously as in the games, Rie Suegara was an excellent addition as Yui (excluding her awkward borderline moans when the character runs). The opening is nice, kind of addictive, and sets the tone pretty perfectly.


But the OST. My god, the OST. The game had some nice BGM, but I swear Yuki Hayashi is a deity. Every piece of music was gorgeous, and, for the most part, truly set the tone of each scene. The music actually captures the menacing undertone to the anime, and each character, and brings at least one aspect of this show to life in a way that does the source material proud.


Character - 6/10

Now, here is where my being the target audience, and a fan of the games, really comes to light.


I know the characters, and I’m going to be honest, I already loved them before the anime. I knew each of their backstories, how each of them will grow in the future, hell, I even know who’s favourite brother is who and who is the only one that actually likes their father. For me, characters and their relationships is what drives this anime, and I can see that for a newcomer it is a flat mess that will concern and confuse them. No character is given enough ‘love’ (for lack of a better term), and we don’t get to see who they really are - which honestly upsets me.


However, if I come at it from an anime exclusive view - if you are, indeed, the right strand of the target audience, you’ll love them. If you are everyone else in the world population, you will hate them. Simple as. This is a cast of sadistic, manipulative assholes, who have no respect for humanity and appear nothing but shallow. The show attempts to tap into what could make them human, attempts to show their development, and it’s personal how you think they did. (Spoiler, nowhere near what the games achieve). You’ll know whether you can tolerate that or not.


And there’s Yui. Some love her, some hate her.


Enjoyment - 8/10

Despite everything, I enjoyed this trainwreck. It’s my guilty pleasure, and it’s a quick watch, so there’s that. It could actually be pretty damn decent, if you remove the whole IDEA of romance from it, and regard it purely as a psychological mindfuck. It’s a poor, poor adaptation of a good horror otome game (note the tags on Wikipedia), but it’s a good one for laughs. Or a drinking game.


Overall - 6/10

tl;dr - It’s okay if you’re the intended target audience, bad if you’re a fan of the game, and horrible if you’re neither. It’s excellent guilty pleasure material, pretty to look at, wonderful to listen to, and it’s already won two seasons and an ova. I guess, give it a shot if you want to see vampires that are seriously inhumane?

I watched this in 3 days straight in the fifteen minutes of downtime before I went to school. Let's just say... my time would probably have been better spent on playing something like candy crush- a time waster game. That's because that's what this was: a time waster. 
Story - What story? A young girl gets sent to a mansion full of pretty boys for reasons unknown. That's it, actually. The reasons remain unknown and there's no clear direction for the plot to go in. In fact, the only real 'plot' moments are the little glimpses of the boy's backstories that we are given everyonce in a while- full of abuse and neglect as if it justifies how absolutely shitty they act (which it never does.) I was never gripped by it and the only reason I kept watching was because of the voice actor's amazing performances and the pretty character designs.


Art - This is pretty much the only area that it scores highly in. The characters are, undeniably, very pretty. The animation isn't the best, but it's tolerable, and the set is beautifully drawn. As an artist myself, I respect how much effort has gone into all of the scenery and the amazing details (not to mention the interesting and aesthetically pleasing character designs). However, pouring gold leaf on dead duck doesn't make it into a swan. 


Sound - I have to say; the voice actors did a really amazing job, given the material that they had to work with. However, the music was forgettable, and I barely remember any moments when I actually even felt tension due to the backing track. Also, I know this has been said a billion times, but biting into human flesh DOES NOT make that kind of noise! It sounded like they were biting into an apple (they probably were, come to think of how they must've recorded it) and god, the SLURPING. Just- slurping and breathing heavily. That's really the  most memorable thing about this. The goddamn slurping noises.


Character - I've already said quite a bit about this but I can summarise all of the boys with the phrase 'angsty vampire garbage boys'. I'm not going to say that their childhood was all good and rosy, but what they went through absolutely in no way should excuse how abusive they are to the main character! Abuse in this series is grossly romanticised and excused with a traumatic backstory. This anime also seems to forget that trauma doesn't make most people abusive, but all of the boys are still super toxic. As for the main character, she's a little dim and when given the opportunity to run doesn't take it because romance, I guess? Unless she has Stockholm syndrome, that is not normal behaviour (and I don't think she does, considering how much she tries to run when she DOESN'T have the opportunity.)


Enjoyment -   -_-


Overall - This should give you an idea - I played the game just because I heard that in certain endings the characters I hated would die. I don't even speak Japanese!! 


Watch it if you want, but if you're used to 'classier' series, don't expect to enjoy it.

I can't believe I watched all 12 episodes hoping that Yui will grow a spine...but no. I lost faith in her when she didn't take the chance to run away. OK, so you're a masochist...explain to us other people what that feels like maybe?
I guess the thing is that "no means yes" and "yes means yes" to these guys. I get that they're vampires without emotions but dang this was borderline criminal.
Blargh.

Gonna be all out honest, I've watched tons and I mean tons of romantic anime and I got to say this is the worst anime I've seen in my life. I mean I am a fair reviewer I usually give 8-10, but this anime is so bad its just utterly worthless.
There is no plot to the story, its just about a girl getting raped 24/7 1/10
Art: pretty bad in my opinion nothing special 1/10
Sound: If you want to hear the sound of a girl scream every episode this anime is for you 1/10
Character: All they do is rape the little girl 1/10
Enjoyment: A show thatshows the weakness of girls, its just so profined I would love to have a talk with the creator man just terrible.\n\n
Overall: 1/10 :The Worst Anime In my Life/ Carrer.

Diabolik Lovers is one of those animes that can really split you down to the middle, depending on the viewer. It's your basic otome game anime with f**ked up plot that'll make your love it or hate it...or just have no idea how the f**k to feel.
Story Rating: 2
As I mentioned, the story is pitiful. I can't say much but, it tries SO HARD to add drama and conflict when they don't need to. Just show the fangirls what they want, and you're done. But, NOOOOOO! We gotta give a plot device that....didn't make sense in the game either but screw it. Seriously, why doso many otome games need that edge, I don't understand...


Art Rating: 8

Even though the art style and animation is your typical anime look and design, it's still really pretty. It's not oscar worthy by any means but, it's still nicely well done. There are times when the animation can go to mediocre but, THOSE COLORS! I'm a sucker for bright colors and this anime! OH! Beautiful colors! Nice and appealing. 


Sound Rating: 9

The music in this anime a lot of the time is nice piano music which, is pretty fitting and relaxing. I could just listen to the OST and be just as satisfied as watching an episode. The Japanese voice actors are great, fit their characters perfectly, which isn't so surprising seeing how they're the same actors from the game except Yui. Also, the opening! Catchy as hell! It'll get stuck in your head, trust me.


Character Rating: 6

Each character has a pretty good reason why you'd go for their route. You've got the sleepy type, the glasses type, the flirt, the shota, the egotist, and the stoic. Basic traits but, have some messed up backstories, especially for Otome game standards. 

Yui, being our heroine is pretty basic and you really do feel sorry for her every time these guys hurt her. She's good in my book, though could use some improvements on making her more interesting. She is helpless which I can't call misogyny because it's an otome anime so, I can let that slide.


Now for the boys...(Gonna go in order by age)

Also, spoiler THEY'RE SADISTIC HURP DERP


Shuu is the eldest brother and sleepy type. He's kind of just....there. He rarely gets screen time, except for just showing how 'scary' he is or to shout exposition. He does have very nice eyes, I'll give him that.


Reiji is the second eldest and glasses type. That's ALLL his character is, except make his sadist levels go up to f**king TEN! Just like Shuu, he's not given much screen time which is a shame, I kind of like him. He's interesting in a....glasses type way? However, as is, he's okay.


Laito is the third eldest and our flirt. He's also the eldest out of his other three brothers. Oh right, Ayato, Kanato, and Laito are triplets. Forgot to mention that. *SIIIIIGH*.....This is why I can't review otome animes....a guy I like will come along and sucker punch me. I can't help but LOVE Laito. I have no idea what it is about this guy! He's a blunt, perverted, motherf**ker! *snickers*

Yet, I love him! I can't really explain it in words. I really can't.


Kanato is the fourth eldest and our shota. He's also a bit of a cock. And by a bit...I mean A LOT! Every chance he time he's on screen he's either talking to his stupid teddy, eating sweets, looking creepy, or throwing a temper tantrum. I'm just like duuude....chill! I can't believe he has fangirls. So yeah...don't like the shota.


Ayato is the fifth eldest and our egotist. He's got an 'Ore-Sama' complex or something like that and he REVELS in it! I hate to say this but, he's the most.....Edward Cullen out of them. I HATE SAYING THAT BUT, IT'S TRUE! I mean, he's not as bad as the sparkling puss, far from it. It's just the more you watch the more....angsty he gets. AND THERE'S NO REASON FOR IT! Literally, one of the episodes ends with him sitting on a balcony, watching the rain. Are you.....f**king with me. SERIOUSLY! Just write 'I'm tortured' on his back while you're at it! Ayato, I like you but, take a happy pill or something. 


Subaru is the youngest and our tsundere. I mean it, he's a total tsun, it's actually kind of funny. He is the nicest (andiusethatloosely) out of the others so, that's good. Gives Yui some f**king breathing space. Sadly, he's given even LESS screen time than Shuu or Reiji. Even though he's the most interesting and the one you'd actually WANT to be with. Shame the anime did that to him, he's probably punching a wall, just thinking about it...


Enjoyment Rating: 6

I won't lie, I did enjoy watching this anime. Of course, I didn't agree with some of it but, I still liked it in some parts where it's not making me want to kick a wall. Maybe it's my inner submissive. I don't know -shrugs-


Overall Rating: 4

I know WHY this anime exists. There IS a demographic for this kind of sh*t and it's pretty big. Even so, they could have at least TRIED to make something better. Overall, I call this anime decent, at best. There are some good things in it but, it all depends on how much bullsh*t the viewer can take. Personally, I'd give it a watch, just for fun. 


Other than that, if you're of age, make this anime into a good drinking game. 


However, if you do like this anime, may I point to you the games and the manga. They're much more enjoyable if you're into it, trust me.

After reading reviews condemning the characters for "border-line rape", my curiosity was piqued. If reverse-harems are designed for female enjoyment (as typical harems are for males), then is this a non-hentai anime catering to FEMALE rape fantasy? (Because we all know plenty of anime for male rape fantasy exists)
A hesitant yes. If this really was meant to please women they went about it the wrong way. The plot is so forced and stupid that the show would have been better without it, as well as any exposition given to explain the situation entirely -- it's so bad, it would have been improved if there wasno explanation at all. A girl just shows up to a house and guys with no background start forcing themselves on her. As soon as they started expounding on that, it was difficult to stomach.


This anime has the subtlety of a teenager's erotic fanfic, and plays exactly like one -- with sexual scenes playing one after another with barely a moment's reflection, and established character forgotten for the sake of... I don't know what exactly (e.g. brothers who hate each other feeding on her at the same time). What is the motivation for their actions? The abuse they received from their mothers? That's the only possibility we're given, and it's only relevant for 4 of the 6 men, but they all act the same way. Why they hate each other is never explored, nor why they live together, why they care about the female character's well-being at all beyond drinking from her. I suppose the only reason they don't completely drain her is that they have to fill 12 episodes. Her being slowly drained at the end of the first episode would've been 10x more erotic than the nonsense we're given (mainly because we would've been spared 12 episodes with these terrible characters).


Some female perverts do not ask for romance, or even context, but we just cannot abide terrible writing. Unless truly desperate, look elsewhere for your rape fantasy fix, my fellow perverts.

I deffinitely have some issues with Diabolik lovers - thought the whole 12 episodes wee see 6 vampire brothers sucking, almost like raping the main female character. As a woman I was a bit disgusted thinking how teen girls would find this show romantic.... I didn't see the supposed romace and connection with some of the brothers - no! Everybody took advantage of the poor girl. At moments it was too much for me. Yui is very weak and lacks courage - i hate how she doesnt try to escape but stays at the house so she could continue being blood bank for the brothers...
Theart is fine but I don't fancy anime with strange hair colours but this is really personal taste and doesn't matter a lot. \n
What I liked - if you keep distance in your mind from brothers' cruelty - I liked how different they are. Everybody has something specific and they are enjoyable. Kanato was my favourite - creepiest of all. \n
It also looked like at the end of the series that they are finally forming some descent story with hidden family secrets so I'll give a try to the second season in april - I really hope the brothers will leave the poor Yui alone and something interesting happens.

WATCH IF YOU LIKE SADISM/MASOCHISM, VAMPIRES, GOTHIC TONES,...ect
DONT BE FOOLED BE THE 1,2, and 3 reviews try it for yourself ad see if it suits you.
I love the show, it does well in telling a complex story in only a matter of 12 episodes, yes it has implied rape, sadists, and masochists, but it tell how vampires are really seen by the public, where they see people as nothing but food, but the show is good to were the start to treat Yui nicer along the way, Zexces did well with the animation and design, i couldn't ask for any better, the show starts slowbut pickes up episode 7.\n\n
I would recommend it to anyone that likes this kind of stuff.

This is my first review so bear with me:
This anime is basically all about biting, licking and sexually harassing the protagonist.
The protagonist, Yui Komori, is a selfless girl who gets treated very badly by the Sakamaki Brothers.  In just 1 episode she gets bitten 3 times (minimum) or more. Please, this anime is no romance, it is all about abusing and it is clearly shown the protagonist is one hell of a masochist. In every stinkin episode she has to trip (seriously, like all of the sudden this rock appears and she just trips over it) and suddenly gets abused by one of thecreepy, insane, sadistic brothers. You can forget about character development because nothing actually happens. The protagonist stays a weakling and the brothers just stay sadistic. Just when you are about to change your mind about one of them, that they might actually be kind, they suddenly go all berserk and suck her blood. My point is... THIS ANIME HAS NO STORY BEHIND IT WHATSOEVER. Have a wonderful day everyone.

As a critic, I'd give this a two at best. But as someone who has, sometimes, unfortunately odd tastes... I'd give this a four.
Story: 3/10
The movement of the plot (wait... what plot?) seems only to be just so that the protagonist is able to spend time with all the handsome vampires who abuse her with their seemingly sadistic ways. More than half way through the episodes, you'll see some real plot inserted but it seems random and only for the purpose of driving off the plot-less accusations. 
Art: 8/10
This seems to be the only redeeming quality of this show. Even after having read a handfulof dreadful reviews telling me to turn away, I continued on because the beautiful art intrigued me. (And I naively thought that the plot couldn't be that bad if the art was so unique and interesting). \n\n
Sound: 6/10\n
The sound was okay. The OP/ED was okay. The voices were okay. It was all okay. Nothing particularly repulsive and nothing particularly ear-catching.\n\n
Character: 2/10\n
If the entire story behind it wasn't bad enough to drive you off... the characters surely would. In my opinion, the characters were worse off than the plot.  Not a single person seemed to have respect for themselves or for others, even with the characters that I believe were supposed to be that type of character. The backgrounds of each don't even begin to make up for their behavior and personalities. I'm not exactly sure what they were thinking when this went to the drawing board but this area needs a lot of work. \n\n
Enjoyment: 6/10\n
What can I say? I watched it all.\n
I wanted more of it by the end of each of the latter episodes. So much so I tried looking into the game after I finished. So I admit I was starting to get intrigued. \n
However, the beginning half of the anime is terrible and plot-less and really only fan-service(?) for those who are into this stuff.\n\n
Overall: 2/10 , 4/10\n
As I mentioned, this anime is dreadful and pathetic it lacks quality in almost every aspect. This is not an anime I would ever recommend to someone unless 1) we were arguing about what is the worst anime, or 2) I know they have this sort of fetish. \n
But as a personal partial enjoyment and the amazing art, I'd say a 4! It's decent if you can get passed the lack of respect and plot.

In my opinion, the anime was alright!
TBH the characters were all well-drawn. They were ALL super good looking and super pretty.
Also, the plot wasn't that bad. I mean, sure, there were a few really stereotypical parts to the plot.. but, there actually was a buildup to a climax.
So, I gave story and art a 5 each.
The part that really killed the anime for me was the character development. I just couldn't bring myself to like ANY of the characters. They were all so bland and stereotypical. All the male vampires were abusive and dominating. The girl just accepted all their abuse, and let herself bemanipulated.\n
The story is mainly told from the girl's perspective. So, it was just painful and frustrating to watch. Hence, why I rated enjoyment with a 2 out of 10.\n\n
If you're into vampires, and the whole 'male dominant over female' kind of relationship/romance, then this might be the right anime for you!\n\n
Overall, for me, this anime was a 4/10.

Based on an otome game, this piece of poorly written anime was a nightmare. I enjoy some otome anime and their games, but I just couldn't stand the "heroine" and those evil boys.
PS: Run - it's trash.
Story:
Was there a story? I've never played the game so everything was pretty much sketchy and confusing in my head. Young silly girl going to an unknown place suggested by a relative, turns out it's full of vampire sadist and she just go for them and enjoy the ride even if she says "no" and "stop". All the boys want her blood, as if it's dinner time and shejust has no spine at all to grab a weapon and fight back. There is also the mom which is also a weird sadist and some weirdly possesion. Can you see the confusion? It makes no sense.


Art:

It was decent. It wasn't anything crazy and beautiful because I'm nitpicky when it comes to animation and their artwork. The eyes showing up over the hair is just not my thing at all.


Character(s):

We got some light background on the boys and barely anything on the girl. It doesn't explain their sadism or how they see her like their last meal. The "heroine" is simply a bride to be (or whatever) and a blood dispenser, that's all I've learned from her. It feels empty and confusing. They are all soo moody and boring and they act like twit all along. Their sob sob stories are not even sad - not a reason enough to have a shitty persona. The girl is naive, cliche and can't grow a spine for her own sake.


Overall + Enjoyment:

It's not something I recommend. AND I SWEAR THE DUDE THAT SAY B***-CHAN EVERY 5 SECONDS, I CANNOT STAND YOU. This is direspectful and disgusting. I was not expecting to rage for a character, but seriously he's shit and I can't stand his voice (eventually had to mute him). The freak with the teddy bear is the epic of weirdos and he needs to stfu and stop getting pissy over a plush. This is worst than Amnesia and other weird thing I've seen based on otome games. I wish I could beat them up with a rolled newspaper, those trash.


Another review stating how shitty it is. I still wonder how I made it out alive without stabbing myself with a fork.

I never thought i would write a review. But this anime has been the worst experience I've ever had with an anime so far. I don't understand why or even how this anime is so popular. If you are like me who saw some posts about how good this is and now want to watch it let me give you a little advice: Don't do watch it. I repeat. DO NOT WATCH IT. If after reading that you still don't believe me Im going to try to explain myself a little bit better...for your sake.
So first we have this high school girl who apparently hasNO backbone and doesn't know how to stand her ground. Walks into this mansion filled with self-absorbed assholes who are vampires and then proceeds to get "Blood Rape" by every. single. one.REALLY. EVERY. SINGLE. ONE. And those "Blood Rape" scenes were handle in a very  weird way. Sometimes I questioned whether I was watching a normal anime or some type of vampire blood sucking porn. This girl was a complete masochist, when she had the chance to escape she didn't. 


All the vampire brothers were wrong. I like twisted characters but for some reason i hated these. Basically these characters had a couple of daddy and mommy issues and nothing else, yet they were on the deep end of crazy town. Oh and it seems they took a page out of Edward Cullen because for some reason that was not mention they (vampires) go to HIGHSCHOOL (well only in one episode but they use the uniform all the damn time). 


In the end I don't even KNOW how i finished it...only to find that THERE IS A SECOND PART?¿?¿? WTF??? People actually enjoyed this??? If you want to watch it after reading the bad reviews then go ahead but be warned. There is not a single redeeming quality in this anime.

How can I describe this. It was bad but boy those vampires were sexy. 
Let's start off the art. The art wasn't that bad. The art was pretty and they did a good job with making the vampires sexy looking. That's the only praise I can really give about this anime.
But the rest I was shocked with. With vampires, I get it, bloodthirsty but why are they so blood thirsty?  They kept abusing the main protagonist and they did borderline kidnap her. One of the vampires been calling the main character "Bitch-chan" (I do lowkey love this but I am just sick like that)and others will suck off of her. There was no plot or meaning why they kept sucking her but they just did (??). The writer could've made a simple excuse like "Vampires get energy when they suck blood so whenever they find a human it's a good opportunity for them". Still that isn't a good excuse but they go with "She has nice blood". Which is a poor excuse. But hey, whatever. Though throughout the whole series they use her as a blood bag. I have no words. 


Even the main female character was annoying. I get that we are supposed to feel like we are actually in the show but with this character, I'm sure  no one can even relate to this character. She is actually plain out stupid and clumsy. Even the vampires taking her in called her annoying and they are just using her! 

Now giving a spoiler but this has to be said: But one of the vampires even tells her that she should leave the house and that vampire even gave her an opening for her. And what does she do? SHE STAYS! I won't spoil anymore but she stays for her own selfish reason and she rather stay for that reason then save her own goddamn life! She is just... Plain... Stupid. 


Nothing about this show is romantic. But I mean if you call abusing a female character romantic just for your own thirsty self  romantic then go ahead, you'll enjoy this.

The first episode is a huge trap...it was good and I thought this was going to be something more memorable...but I was damn wrong!
So the story starts with our protagonist Yui a seemingly "normal"girl who is forced by her own father to live in a mansion since he's working overseas as a Priest(?) And after entering the mansion she finds out all the inhabitants are hot vampires who are only interested in her blood and Yui our inept heroine can't escape from them.
What interest me in continuing this was the mystery. Such as why in the world did her father send her there in thefirst place? Is he in on it with the vampires? Is she special since her blood smells more delicious then normal? Another intriguing  factor was the sakamaki brothers(vampires) who at episode 1 gave an atmosphere of horror and thrill that I deeply enjoyed...but man that was short-lived. I was expecting a much more bigger twist but the twist they pulled here was "meh". In the end it had a lot of plot-holes.


Moving on to the characters, two words: masochist and sadist. It easily describes our heroine and her vampire harem. Other than that vampire bros appear flat and are archetypes for boys you want to date. Another thing if these boys are vampires with power why in the world do they need to go to school for and why did they showcase a school when really the school never went with the plot. Don't get me started on Yui, she has no guts whatsoever and her only redeeming quality is her kind ignorance.


The art and animation was so-so but I was more impress with the music. I really love the opening and ending song which match the the haunting theme which the anime lacks.


Overall, I was entertained only to a limited extent. Even for a otome game based anime it was bad and yes i watch other otome animes and know which is good. I would not recommend this but hey if your only into watching your bishies getting it on then go ahead but be warn the plot gave me a few dead brain cells.

I go in the order of Story,Art, Sound, Character, Enjoyment, and Overall.. I am here to review not give you meaningless bs.
Story: 4
As a harem anime lover I expected a twist here, besides the main being used brutally.. There seems to be some history between her father and the vampire family which has me intrigued more then the rest of the show.. I'm still hoping for one of the brothers to show a shred of decency, but it seems unlikely.. I gave the story a 4 because there are some intriguing factors, but it feels like there just gonna beat up on the main.
Art: 7
Thisis always a high factor for many shows, the characters are unique and designed well. Although so far, the setting is normally in the house or school.. Since there are only two locations; the Art feels recycled, thus why I give it a rating of 7.


Sound: 6


Personally, I can't say I'm fond of the OP or ED; but they fit the show well. I gave it a 6 here because most of the sound design fits the show, but really isn't memorable.. 


Character: 6


Even though the development of the characters is quite low, they are pretty quick to establish the characters personalities, Mannerisms, etc. They all just seem mean in general, but with some of the development that is there you see that some of the brothers if not just one, weren't always that way.. 


Enjoyment: 3


To be honest, I haven't really enjoyed watching this whatsoever. I'm not to keen on abusing or using women, so watching this kinda doesn't go down well.. I don't even know if I will finish the series.. gave it a 3 here ..


Overall: 5


Considering above, this teeters between a 5-6 overall.. I went with the 5 because the numbers were closer.. Personally, I wouldn't recommend this show at all, but a lot could change from episode 6 to 12.. If your chill with abusive scenes, I say give it a go.. I don't know yet if I'll keep watching, just felt it needed a fair review.

This is my first ever review. I had to make it to warn people. So here we go.
DON'T WATCH THIS SHIT!!!
I am serious. You will only waste your time. After watching 5 episodes hoping that SOMETHING good would happen to the main character I became even more disappointed as more and more dudes would pick on her, bully her, everything short of raping her.... I am sure that it comes to this considering it has a second season.... Now how the fucking hell did that happen?
This author must have had a very weird childhood or simply really weird fetishes. I can't for the life ofme understand how anyone would like this. The only thing that I do not consider completely horrendous is the art. It got pretty good art. That's it.\n\n
ANYHOW--- DO NOT WATCH THIS SHIT

Diabolik Lovers is an anime about one girl and six hoot vampire guys. Through the 12 episode season, where each episode is 15 minutes long, it's easy to find problems with the anime. But that being said, I don't think it was a total waste.
Story: 2/10
The story, despirte it's obvious cheesiness and predictable events, had a lot of plot holes. All these left me with questions even after I finished the anime, such as:
☻ How come whenever Yui is about to get her blood sucked she turns her head so HER NECK is facing the vampire?
☻ What happened to everyone else's mothers?
☻ Where is theboy's fathers?

☻ Why did they stop going to school after the first episode?

☻ Why is Yui's blood even THAT good?

And many more!


Art: 8/10

I did enjoy the art. I really did. The character design was amazing, especially since not every character looked the same. The backgrounds (especially the night ones) were quite enjoyable.


Sound: 5/10

The opening was great, I did think it really fit the whole theme with vampires and mwhahaha evil stuff like that. I always skipped the ending though, it was pretty boring.


Character: 2/10

First, can we just talk about Yui. Like, why hasn't she taken up self defense yet? You would think that being there for over a month (since there were two full moons wow look I'm decently smart) she would've done at least SOMETHING. I know that she can't beat everyone up but come on, she's practically like everyone's play toy that they just can't get enough of. Oh and also, did I mention that she is EXTREMELY naive?


Just in case you were wondering, I have evidence (woah look applying knowledge from school) for this.

You see, Yui actually gets bitten so many times, I started making a list of some of the different places where it happens, and here are just some:

☻ A bathtub

☻ A cemetery 

☻ A church

☻ Yui's bedroom

☻ Underwater (in a pool)

And lots lots more ^-^


The other guys are okay. They all have a past which makes their morals somewhat there. However, they really don't go through any change. They end the way they started, even after all Yui's efforts to change them.


Enjoyment: 7/10

Now I know I'm kind of contradicting myself here, but for some reason I did enjoy this series. Maybe it was because I was laughing at how cheesy it was. Maybe it was because I wanted to see if Yui ended up dying in the end. Maybe it was because I ship Yui x Ayato (a lot).


Overall: 5/10

Well, this anime sure was something. Not in a good way, but not in a bad either. And maybe it's just me but I'm planning on watching the second season.

Someone actually recommended this show to me, saying it was "very intense".
Intensely IQ draining? Intensely boring? Intensely repetitive? I agree. This show is definitely "intense".
There was about 4 minutes of plot and character development related content in between glamour shots of male vampires and the girl making gasping noises. Most of the episodes revolved around the girl willingly walking into danger, getting the danger she deserved, then begging for it to stop. 
The protagonist has no personality. The antagonist has no personality. The hot boys are overused cliches. The senseless plot is an overused cliche with no personality. 
You will enjoy this show if:
1. Youlove useless heroines\n
2. Pseudo BDSM makes you blind to everything else\n
3. You only care about the art style\n
4. You are already brain dead

Okay, I'm actually seriously ashamed to admit that I watched all 12 episodes in one night, but in my defense each episode is only, what, 12 minutes? I watched everything not because I thought it was any good, but because I just HAD to see how it ended. It was just so horrible that I needed to see if it got any better. 
I don't even remember how I found out about this anime, but I do remember feeling intrigued by the title and the artwork. I was expecting romance, but boy was I wrong. I mean, who the hell puts the word 'lovers' ina title and not actually have lovers in the story? 


The story (1/10): 

Pathetic describes this anime perfectly. It's like a Theatre of the Absurd -- it has no plot, no point, nada nada nada. The story's literally about a helpless girl who falls prey to a bunch of ridiculously handsome vampires. The end. 


The art (8/10):

The artwork's just about the only good thing about this anime. But does that somehow outweigh the other horrible qualities of the anime? Don't even dream about it. 


The characters (1/10): 

The protagonist has no personality, no voice, no strength, nothing. I was hoping that she would stand up for herself, but she's outrageously quiet and boring. As for the male characters, I can't seem to distinguish them. Why are there so damn many of them? Okay, fine, some of them are distinguishable. But why have a gazillion brothers that aren't THAT different? 


The enjoyment (3/10):

I wish I could show you what my face looked like the entire time. It looked like I was smelling Satan's farts. The only words that were going through my head as I was watching the anime were: W. T. F


Overall (2/10):

I would've given it a 1/10, but the art boosts it up to a 2.

I went in this Anime completely blind without really knowning what it was about, nobody influenced me with their opinion and the only information I got were 6-seconds-AMVs on Vine. I knew that many people really liked this Anime and from the first looks I got it seemed really good.
It seems there are only two ways you can view this Anime: Amazing or Awful. 
About two minutes in I knew this would be one of the most horrible Anime I've seen in a long time. And for the people who found it Awful there are two kinds too: The ones who are really angry aboutit and the ones who find it so bad they have to laugh.

I'm the last one.


I was laughing in every episode because of how ridiculous just everything in this Anime was, when it tried to be serious I laughed tears repeating "What is this?!" over and over again. I still can't believe how well entertained I was by this Anime and I was seriously thinking about giving the Anime a full 10 in everything, but decided against it because I wanted to write a helpful review not a trolling one.


Diabolik Lovers you really can't take seriously. If you don't, it's a straight 10, but if you do it is an ant against an elephant compared to other Anime, full of bad stereotypes you've seen in countless Harem Anime and a really, really painfully dumb protagonist who wouln't even be able to breath by her own without the help of a handsome dude (exaggerated a little).


Overall a really bad Anime.

Gonna watch the second season now, for the lolz.


-Luxbecca



Ps. Sorry if there are grammar and spelling mistakes

Some vampires who still seem to be in high school all live together with a human girl. One of the vampires has a teddy bear that he talks to... Yeah, you heard me right. 
After just five episodes I get to hear about how worthless the girl–since I can't remember her name I'll just call her Little Bitch–is to them, being a human and all. I also get to see her get bitten and battered in nearly every scene. And apparently this was adapted from an otome game, which astounds me because I would hate to make this nightmare any worse by making it interactive.\n\n
What's worse is that Little Bitch didn't even fight back, and it felt like she lost, like we lost. And honestly, it just got boring. I know that Little Bitch is supposed to be weak so that the hero can be strong for her and all that, but in this case there really is no hero. And honestly, each time the vampires laughed at her for how pathetic she was I almost started to believe them. Little Bitch is an empty shell of a character who exists at the whim of a bunch of vampires and the show is a plotless train wreck that exists at the whim of a seriously unsophisticated fanbase.

It took everything I had not to drop this terrible piece of work. At first glance I saw a reverse harem (which I personally enjoy) that was beautifully drawn (another enjoyment) that also just so happened to include a supernatural element (so much potential enjoyment). I read the description and proceeded to watch the first episode. It was awful. The characters were rubbing off as abusive weirdos and I forced myself to continue cause I thought there might be an okay story line and was hopeful that the characters would develop into something better along the line. I was wrong.
~No enjoyment whatsoever. I'd have tobe paid to watch this anime again.\n
~There was barely a story line and what of it only came around towards the end of the anime- In which I had already wasted my time in watching. It was weak and didn't leave an impression.  \n
~The art was lovely. I really enjoyed it. Pity it was wasted on such a terrible show.\n
~The sound was decent. It did sound sort of... vampiric.\n
~The characters were awful. If you're into S&M (Sadism/Masochism) than you'll probably like the way they all treated each other and reacted. Yui was a girl with no backbone and not a single intelligent thought in her brain and the brothers were all terrible to her. They didn't like her to any extent as you would expect from a supposed romance anime. They lusted after her and her blood but in such a way where it wasn't even attractive. Just.. creepy. \n

If you're into good looking guys sucking blood from a girl without a main plot, I definitely recommend it. However, personally this isn't something that I really enjoyed watching. The art was fine, probably the only thing that kept me going. The way the characters are, their personalities was something that i didn't like at all. I don't recall an actual plot present throughout the series all I remember is that a guy would take her somewhere "special" to him and then: bloodsucking, bloodsucking, bloodsucking, and more bloodsucking.
Keep in mind that this was just my opinion, and if you liked it then that's that...

I would not advise anyone to watch this show. 
What originally drew me in to watching this show was the description and the tags. I'm a sucker for anything vampire, and I'll watch pretty much anything tagged vampire even if people think it's the worst. This show is a perfect example as to why a lot of people think vampire based shows and movies suck (heh). Secondly, it's known as being reverse harem and I have a soft spot in my heart for reverse harems. 
What I actually got was a misogynistic cycle of abuse that honestly made me feel sick. The truth of thematter is that this show is meant for girls. It has at least a decent enough following to be fairly high up on the list for popularity, and it was meant to appeal to women. I genuinely feel sorry and concerned due to that. \n\n
If you want to watch 12 episodes of dull characters abusing a young girl, including non consensual sexual implications, with the cover of a story line that is weak and makes little to no sense, this is the show for you.

Let me just say, what the ****.
