Uh yeah. This anime is bad. I watched it because I wanted to see if it was as bad as everyone said it was.
Aaaaaand it is. 
Let's start with story. All I understood was a young girl moves into a house with tons of hot vampire boys. And that's mostly it. I forget the ending because I was to busy cringing at the horrible characters. 
SPEAKING OF CHARACTERS. Lets' talk about them. 
The main female lead is as interesting as an uncooked plain bagel. She's nothing but a total idiot who doesn't know that her life is practically in danger, and she doesn't want toleave her situation because...actually, I DONT KNOW WHY! There's a scene where she has a perfect way out and she doesn't even take that chance! She just sits in her room and cries and mopes. \n\n
All of the boys are awful too. Not only are they abusive scumbags, but they're boring. Nothing but stereotypes. One is stoic and Kyoya Ootori like (Ouran High School Host Club), one is into sweet things and holds a stuffed bear, one is kind of secluded and quiet, one is hot headed and so on and so forth. Their backstories about their bad parents didn't help me sympathize with them either. \n\n
I understand the point of a harem/ a reverse harem is so that the main character is kind of a Lego piece. You can put yourself in their place and be the object of many boys affection. But not only would NO woman want to be in this situation ever, there is just no point. Non of the characters are worth anyone's affection, unless you like that abusive type of guy. \n\n
Literally the only good part of this anime is the opening theme song. I like it and I think it's catchy. And it did hype me for episode 1 so I thought that everyone was just being to emotional. But nope. Its a bad show\n\n
God this anime is just bad. I know there is a second season but I did not and will not watch it.

You should not come to this anime expecting a nice romance, deep plot line,  and originality. You should come to this anime just wanting to waste a few hours watching pretty vampires sucking a submissive girl's blood.  In a sense, it may satisfy a little fetish you have, because the blood sucking scenes happen to be quite hot...
Story: 4/10 
There are many obvious holes in the plot, but the plot is rather simple, and is something you should not think much of, but rather, just go along with it. A high school girl moves to a mansion full of smexy sadistic vampires whoall love to suck her blood and screw with her. Simple enough, right?


Art: 7/10


The art is actuallly very unique, especially the eyes. The dark toned artwork is very fitting for this anime. I would not watch this if not for the nice artwork...


Sound: 6/10

Nothing special, though the opening is very catchy :D. The music is just a nice little touch in the background to complement the scenes.


Characters: 7/10


Each character is interesting and unique in their own way, but each being very sadistic. The girl's submissive personality can be quite annoying, but it can't be helped, since she is based off an otome game character.


Enjoyment:  7/10


This anime is just a nice little way to waste 4 hours. You'll probably enjoy the blood sucking scenes. I do not understand the other reviews saying this anime is disgusting, all that happens is blood sucking and sparkles.


Overall: 7/10


A short anime to waste your time on. Definetely not romance, but rather a show you should come to watch for the pretty characters and sexy scenes :p.  It is not revolting as the other reviews say they are.

This anime is absolute crap, shoveled off of your neighbors driveway after it was left to bake and fester in the summer sun for hours. If you look closely, one can observe the steam coming off of this ugly turd.
Yes, this anime is bad. That's an understatement; it's horribly atrocious and deserves to be killed with fire.
Here's what you'll get when you watch this anime: A bunch of "kawaii" guys who are actually sadistic, disgusting pedophiles that want nothing more than to ravage and rape this pigeon-brain of a woman. Oh and don't forget they treat her like absolute garbage. 
And what's more, people likethis crap. They fantasize about being taken advantage of and treated worse than the amoebas your chemistry teacher burns to death with his hydrochloric acid.


The art is decent and the girl is the only redeeming factor is you look past how stupid she is. This is what she does: "No, stop Ayato-kun" and that's all the fight she puts up. She doesn't slap them, she doesn't stab them, she doesn't pop a cap in their ass, she just lets it happen.


It gets to the point where you're watching the same thing every episode: our MC getting molested by pedophiles. Not very enjoyable unless you're into that kind of disgusting thing.


The plot of this show is non-existent. Out of the 10 minutes of seeing this girl treated like she's cattle, you'll occasionally see her go, "Ow. My heart." And the "story" only comes into play in the last 3 episodes. It's no story. My dog could write a better story about how he chases his tail and likes to scratch his butt on the wall, and that would be far more entertaining and fulfilling of a story than this one.


Don't watch this show unless you just have to add it to your list of anime under your belt. It's not fun, it's not enjoyable, and it's not worth your time.


Thanks for reading. I hope this review saves you from 12 episodes of banging your head on your desk and singing Jesus loves me songs.

To say that I had difficulty going through this show would be lying, though I remember ranting and venting about it a lot when it was airing. Before starting it, I already had a very bad impression of it because I had the feeling it tried to promote some sort of “woman abuse” without going onto the hentai fetish path. I didn’t understand why some girls would like their boyfriends to abuse them and still accept them after all. It’s a very touchy issue, mostly because most victims of abuse tend to “minimize” their situation because they hope for some sort of change for thebetter, somehow similar to the heroine, I guess, just that you can add a spark of Stockholme Syndrome to Yui too. Yet, let’s keep in mind that Diabolik Lovers is originally an otome game and seriously, the BDSM fetish exists and some girls do have the rape/abuse fantasies, however, WARNING, I do not justify rape and abuse under any means! Play is something, reality is something else entirely! lol And knowing that, I tried to take it seriously and try to understand why the characters act the way they do, while keeping my mind open and that’s why I can say that I did somehow enjoy it after all.


Keeping in mind that I did not play the Diabolik Lovers otome game, the story, the way it’s portrayed by the anime, is kind of…sketchy, to use a diplomatic term. Maybe because of the lenght or for some other reason, I had an issue with the fast “affection” the vampires started to feel for Yui, or the interest, or whatever you want to call it: the overall development of the story, as well as Yui’s overall behaviour and ambigous execution of the plot. Yui didn’t react as a normal person should and would from episode 1 right after Ayato pushed her down the first time and it was seriously frustrating for me to watch her or try to relate to her situation/understand why she would come to love or even “like” the vampires. While in terms of “abuse” it wasn’t as much as I initially expected and I did develop soft spots for some of the guys, I still can’t understand why somebody would adapt so fast to getting bitten 24/7, sexually harassed, verbally harassed, mentally traumatized, poisoned (I’m not even kidding you!) and then be like “awwww come here sexy, pitiful vampires!”. It does not work like that. I would have attempted to commit suicide at least 5 times during the progression of the show. No matter how sexy the guys I live with are…Unless I am such an M that i would secretly enjoy the abuse…and HOLY SHIZ THAT MAKES SENSE!

.

.

.

.


I still fail to understand Yui. She wasn’t as bad as Amnesia‘s unnamed heroine, but she wasn’t far at all, and for no reason at all either. This only accentuated her “dull doll” image whose only purpose was to get chased and pushed back and forth between the different vampires because apparently a heroine with personality would just take the spotlight from the poor poor pitiful vampires….or would just get killed faster. PLEASE.

Excepting the heroine, the vampire protagonists have quite a bit of backstory that might explain their messed up behaviours and lack of common sense or morales. Of course, it managed to “explain” it, but not “justify” it; I refuse to justify “abusers”. The most fleshed out in my opinion was Ayato. He’s also one of my personal favorites exactly because I could figure him out to a bigger extent than the others and he wasn’t technically THAT bad (no, still not justfying or minimizing it, but compared to others, Ayato, Shuu and Subaru might be the most “innocent”).


Switching to some good aspects that I did not consider before, though, the portrayal of vampires Diabolik Lovers has is…not original, but fresh. It goes out of the Twilight-trend or the Vampire Knight-trend; I’m not sure when it started. Whatever fiction has been saying for the last 10 years or so, vampires are not supposed to be Prince Charming and vampires.do.not.sparkle (I’m sorry, I couldn’t resist XD) and vampires do not have weird-shit powers like spitting fire and growing weeds. Technically, vampires are not supposed to be handsome either, but it makes way more sense than everything above so I can forgive that. I wished Diabolik Lovers vampires wouldn’t hide their messed up personalities behind the justification of “abuse”, but I guess that makes it quite ironical, thinking how some of them tend to abuse the heroine in a similar way as they were abused in childhood, without spoiling that too much.


The design of the characters is gorgeous. Even Yui is quite pretty and not bland looking at all, whatever the guys say, so goodjob Rejet. Though the animation is nothing to praise and is overall too static like ZEXCS always likes to do, the bleak looking colors do a good job in toning the general atmosphere. In a mix with the amazing OST which is seriously the strongest part of Diabolik Lovers together with the voice acting, it’s just a pleasure for the eyes and ears. The OST reminds me a lot of a modernized version of the old-fashioned pipe organ music used for those classical horror movies and it seriously gives me lots of feels.


In conclusion, I don’t think that Diabolik Lovers anime has a good story. It’s something that attempts to be dark for the sake of being “dark” and not the other way around. I don’t have a big issue with the ideas as much as I had with the execution of them; of course this is my own humble opinion. I know there are those people out there that praise Diabolik Lovers as some kind of masterpiece, but to me it’s all because of the 50 Shades of Gray-ish trend going around from 2012-2013 to today. And because I made this parallel before and lots of people seems to like to bash on it, YES! I find Amnesia a better story than Diabolik Lovers and I have no issue admitting it! Now I can’t wait to see what will they put Yui through in the sequel….

Okay, so i've finished watching this anime and I have to say the story is  VERY VERY WEAK!
Story:
Well its the usual, helpless girl sent to a house filled with handsome vampire guys, for some reason which wasn't really narrated properly.......and whats a vampire themed anime without bloodsucking? well your in luck! its teaming with bloodsucking! (if your in to that stuff)
Character:
Hmmm.......Well the vampire characters are pretty much the same as any other vampire themed shows, such as possessive, rude and callous behavior. The main character Yui Komori a very gullible girl who seems to have no BACK BONE! can't even stand up for herself!lets vampires suck her blood blah blah -_-\n\n
Enjoyment: \n\n
Well if your into the whole vampire man domination and a girl victim well you'll enjoy this anime! \n\n

This is possibly the worst anime that I have ever watched. I'm not even sure it deserves a two, but here it goes.
The plot and characters have little to no development. The plot is actually pretty stereotypical and run-of-the-mill, and as it is, does not completely offend me. The art too is probably one of the redeeming qualities about the anime. It is well-rendered, and I certainly have no complaints about the male characters in terms of looks. However, this is where this review is going to take a downturn so be prepared. Let me just start off by saying borderline and implied rape, molestation,and anti-feminism. Okay, so while most shoujo animes and mangas aren't exactly very pro-feminism, this anime takes the cake in regards to anti-feminism. Each episode is progressively even worse than the last episode.


In spite of all this, I kept watching, and I regret doing so. I hoped, practically prayed, the female protagonist would fight it, but instead, she only strikes out every episode after episode. The problem is, the protagonist lets all the of aforementioned happen to her. Other than crying out words like "no," she doesn't even try to escape. Just at least give me a knee to the groin, for goodness sake, anything would have done honestly.


Kudos to her for trying to run away, but completely failing. Even so, I didn't find this to be redeeming enough to save the anime. It still remains on my worst anime ever list, and I will happily try to never think about this anime again after writing this review.

I am aware that this is a reverse harem, full of handsome guys etc. However, The plot doesn't go anywhere. I wonder how I managed to endure watching it on one sitting. I actually wonder how the main girl managed to survive living in that house full of vampires who take turns on tasting her blood. I wonder how she wasn't traumatized or something.
I really appreciate the art and the soundtrack (esp. some piano in it) as well as the voice actors. Although overall, watching it is a complete waste of time.

While most people will tell you that they hate it or love it, I'm happy to go in the gray lines. I admit I don't like most things done with vampires, not because of Twilight, but because half of it is unoriginal. However I'm just happy this keeps to some type of formula that we expect coming from more...'traditional' vampire.
Don't go into this wanting love and romance. Don't go into this thinking the heroine won't get abused. And for the love of God don't go into this thinking it'll have a happy ending. This series is dark, the heroine get's flung around, and she isnot getting a way out. 


Now I'm sure this has your blood pumped, but due keep in mind this is geared for fangirls. So no you don't get impressive action scenes and strange torture scenes, but you do get superb music and gorgeous art. The Japanese voice acting is perfect while the English is solid. Of course that's depends on if you're dying to hate English dubs...The characters are mostly tropes, but for what it's worth this is based off an otome game, what did you expect?


Anyway, all together it's an alright anime. Nothing 'new' is brought to the genre, but it is refreshing to see a 'romance' vampire anime that's dark and borderline horrific.

A friend recommend it to me when we talked about new anime and she bring up this anime and I decide to give it a watch.
After watching I really have to question this....are all shojo girls/main characters today are stupid as a door nail? and I found it awful and wasn't impress.
Yui is so stupid; rather then just try to fight back or running away and find her friends or a family member; she stays to where all of the vampire brothers treat her like trash, use her a walking blood bank, belittle her and just do as they please to the point where yourolled your eyes at this anime.

The male characters are just cruel and horrible when she didn't even do nothing to them.

Even when a threat appeared later on, sadly its bad as it is.

The Story; its the usual shojo harem cliches and dreadful.


The only two thing I'll give credit is; 


1-The colors are very eye-catching and how neon and bright.


2- This somehow follows the Vampire Lore, some holy things and places won't harm them, they are monsters and they are lustful only after one thing: Blood.


This was an awful anime, and fans of the game stated it was horrible.

I hope this type of shojo *characters* will not continue the trend.

I can accurately describe this anime in 2 words: torture porn. The plot of this anime is basically that a young girl is sent as a sacrifice to the vampire brothers, but rather than just eating her and getting it over with, the audience is treated to absolute sadism and torment of this girl. 
The brothers themselves have barely anything different about them. They are all just sadistic pricks who want to suck Yui's blood, and have no real defining character traits outside of that. Yui herself just gets tormented and abused no matter what, and most of the anime is just hearing her cryin pain as one of the 7 interchangeable bishies torture and verbally abuse her. Not a single character in this anime gets any sort of development or becomes more likable in the slightest.\n\n
While the art and music are technically good, I still don't think that is a reason to subject yourself to this trainwreck of an anime. The art isn't anything mindblowing, and certainly won't save this anime from the fact that it's unwatchable. While there are worse animes out there, Diabolik Lovers is still hard to watch, and giving it 1 star is generous.

I'm a fan of this anime. It's not perfect but it's no where near horrible either.
I actually like the story. It's interesting and I love getting to know what happens next. Yui's "awakening" was a cool plot point to add in and I loved learning about the backstories of the characters. As you watch the show, you begin to understand why the characters act the way they do.
The animation's fine...but the art's freaking amazing. It's different but in a good way. Their eyes have multiple colors in them and it really adds to the looks of the characters. 
The sound is another thing this animedid right. A lot of the music is really nice to listen to and it fits the moment. They have music for when the characters do their usual vampire thing (drinking blood) and for when things just get intense and action packed. But, I will admit that the sound effects are kinda cringey. It's not cringey in a bad way, it just sounds a bit weird when they bite Yui. It sounds like they're biting into a fruit...


Anyway, all the guy characters seem fine. They all have consistent personalities, flaws, and strengths like characters should. Then there's Yui... To be honest, when I watched this anime for the first time, Yui's personality was the one thing I really didn't like. She's so passive and even when she says "deteitte" or "get out" there's hardly any force behind her words. It's like she barely tries to put up a fight. As a character, Yui's annoying at times (for multiple reasons) but, eventually, you end up remembering her situation and then you just feel a little bad for her. She almost feels out of place. (Then again, taking characters out of their comfort zones is something that people do.)


Story: 9 


Art: 10 (Beautiful)


Sound: 10 (Sound as in the songs and OSTs)


Characters: 9


Enjoyment: 8 (The sound effects made me cringe a little at times. Other than that, everything's good.)


Diabolik Lovers isn't too special since it's just a vampire harem anime but it did have some good ideas with the plot. Overall, it gets a 9.

This is one of those Guilty Pleasure anime. You either hate it or enjoy it. Since I am a little masochist and into kinky vampire biting scenes, this anime satisfies all my needs. Because EVERY episodes have at least 2 biting scenes! (except the first episode) 
The story is very under developed as each episode is only 14 mins long and it seems like the creators only focus on the biting scenes for masochist viewers. Watch the gameplays on youtube or buy it, if you would like to know more about the story and the characters.
I particularly like the soundtracks of this anime and theops. \n
The characters are drawn very well and very appealing,  but not much development. \n
Overall, I am a fan of this anime because of the hot vampires and the biting scenes. (ashamed) That's it. \n
This anime is definitely not for everyone. As for me, I've fallen into this Diahell fandom and there seems to be no way out...\n\n
P.s- Liking this anime doesn't mean that I support sexual abuse, verbal abuse, humiliation, objectifying women in real life.

I am a Twilight fan, and I actually did enjoy FSoG in its original form, but I HATED this anime with a firey burning passion! I wanted so badly to like it... the art style drew me in instantly, and when I found out that it was a vampire anime, I was all the more interested. But I think I barely got through three episodes before I tapped out. I see a lot of people defending it, saying it's a story of sadism and masochism, and others saying its horror... but sadism/masochism is a consensual relationship, this was not. In the episodes I watched, thisgirl was clearly not on board with this, clearly not interested, and continued to say no and to struggle. And as far as horror goes.. ok... but there was such a strong sexual component to it that it didn't come across as horror, it came across as a rape fantasy that is repeated over and over again. Them forcibly taking her blood - in a very sexually suggestive manner - is a metaphor for rape. I can't believe this got a second season. 


I really wish I had read some reviews before watching because I would never have picked it up. If you are looking for a dark but romantic anime, this anime is NOT for you. If you are sensitive to rape and abuse, this anime is NOT for you. 


There is no romance here... just darkness... and the glorification of what is essentially rape and abuse. The main female character is abused and manipulated, the vampires' blood taking is essentially rape. She is physically and verbally abused - and according to many of those that have watched the anime all the way through, sexually abused at one point - and treated like both a plaything and like cattle. At no point in what I watched was the girl consulted about her own fate, nor were any of the boys' actions stopped. 


Suffice to say, I will not be continuing this anime. If you really enjoyed this anime and got something totally different from it, then more power to you... we all have our kinks... but people really should be warned before watching. Abuse and assault is so common you never know who has gone through something that would make watching this anime an incredibly unpleasant experience.

You really did it Japan. You finally did it. You did the one think that is unthinkable. You made Twilight the anime.....Just...Bravo....Brav-F*cking-o
For those that don't know I am Josh and today, I am reviewing the anime Twilight the anime version. Or if you want to get technical with it or whatever I guess you could call it Diablok Lovers
 Story- About some girl thst gets sent to some mansion or whatever by her father. There she is staying with a bunch of guys that...get this...Are vampires. So we got a reverse harem full of vampires...No comment.
In all reality this is basically just about that girlbeing weak as hell and barely fighting back as these guys suck her blood and potentially if they already didn't, rape her....Yeah.


I'm not a big fan on harems to begin with, I hate them about as much as most slice of life and romance anime I have seen. This didn't make me like the concept of harems any better and I could still give two flying sh*t about it. Overall the story is 2/10


Art- The art for the most part is fine. It's average compared to some of the stuff I have seen and watched. If not particular bad. 6/10


Sound- The opening fits Twilight the anime version but I could care less about it. The voice acting was alright for the most part, the person voicing the girl was the only bad one to me out of all of them. Overall it gets a 4/10


Characters- These guys...Ha....They were this close to beating out Madicko Douchebago (Makoto Itou...or whatever the hell you want to call him. Don't give a damn if he was written like he was, I don't like those type of people either way so he doesn't get a pass as far as I am concerned) This close...but they just missed out of beating him out of my most hated characters in anime in general. So close. Then there is the girl...absolute f*cking example of a damsel in distress that can't do jack diddly. Overall the characters ranging from the psycho kid to the guy calling her 'little bitch' get a 1/10 


Enjoyment- ....It's twilight the anime version. Need I say more people.


Overall- In the end this show is mainly for people into masochist type sh*t or guys that like seeing girls get abused. The only ok qualities were the art and sound for the most part. Overall the show gets a 2/10 from me.


That being said I am out people. Peace!

I've can only find negative reviews while the overall grade of the show is 5.6, so I'm here to give a review from the perspective of a 6-7 average.
I don't think anyone is going to go into this show looking for a masterpiece, because let's be real, the people who watch reverse harems (like myself) are really just in it for shits and giggles. It's not something that is meant to be compared to bigger shows like Fullmetal or something, but shows of its kind. That's why its ratings are so poor.
Firstly, I would like to point out that there are some major flaws inthe way the developers decided to market these characters. Having a troubled bad boy character is perfectly acceptable, but they crossed the line with (what was basically) rape, harassment, and misogyny. The characters are flawed beyond redemption and their disgusting treatment of Yui should not be the highlight of the show.



Story: 5


It's alright. Not amazing or terrible, just enough to keep viewers watching in hopes that something will actually happen. (Which unfortunately, nothing does lol). 


Initially, the setup and everything was good and I was curious to see where it went (and I also really enjoyed the boys' backstories). While it wasn't really unique, I thought it was interesting and it laid the groundwork for some awesome storytelling and secrets. 


I gave it a 5 because while the build up was nice, the execution really flopped and I was left with more questions than answers, especially with the third season no where in sight.


What really saves this score were the flashbacks. I found them interesting and they were the only thing that made me feel bad for the brothers. The approach the show took to their father and his wives was new to me, and while it was uncomfortable from a moral and feminist standpoint, it wasn't praised in any way by the anime.


They took a lot of risks by touching on dark topics like rape of minors by parents, crippling abuse, and broken family life. You don't see these things in anime often, especially not romance, so I applaud them for that. Now, I'm not sure if these topics belongs in a romance, but this is marketed as a dark story and the characters need a reason to be so fucked up, so I understand including it. 



Art: 10 (100 if possible lol)


I don't care what anyone says, I adore the art! Absolutely love it.


It breaks off from traditional anime style and gives the story an almost gothic and romantic twist just from how the characters are drawn alone. It's a breath of fresh air after watching so much anime that looks identical. So 10 all the way.


If the brothers were drawn in any other way, they would have been that much more unsavory. Being pretty helps them get away with their shitty personalities lol.


The backgrounds were lacking most of the time, but I feel like the character designs and style make up for it. Each character had a design that matched their personality, and while it was a bit gaudy at times (the fedora or his one rolled up pants leg), it fit them well.



Sound: 7


Not gonna lie, I don't really pay attention to sound. But the dub was good in my opinion. I've definitely heard worse. 


My only problem was the embarrassing grunts and slurping sounds. Also Yui, but she was an irritating heroine, so it fit her. 


The background music, from what I remember, was reminiscent of gothic church choir (a good choice for all its symbolism and sacrilegious themes lol) and suspense music. It was eerie and fitting.



Character:3


I'm not going to rewrite what everyone's written a thousand times. You get the gist. 


I give them a three because they were cute kids, and had a few vulnerable moments. 



Enjoyment: 9


As a person who's a disgusting romantic and rev harem nut, I'll swallow just about anything, and this was no exception. 


This is the type of show you watch because it's bad and silly and because you have a thing for dominant boys, not because you want to watch a riveting anime.


You already know what this show is like, so unless you're the same as me, don't even stress over it. If this is the type of thing you're into though, I completely recommend it because more people love it than you think.



Overall: 6


I wish they carried the storyline along better. I heard the anime did the video game injustice, so it's really a shame. Aside from plot and character shortcomings, it's a hilarious watch and a fun way to spend the afternoon.

If I had to sum up this anime in two words that would be - missed potential.
Diabolik lovers has wonderful artwork and soundtrack, and relatively interesting characters,  however the story felt incredibly incomplete. The main character has little to no character development whatsoever, preventing the series from growing to an satisfying extent. Yui is an adorable and kind character, however her naivete is incredibly frustrating and the reason why this anime has many bad reviews.  Her inability to grow was incredibly frustrating to the viewer. 
Unfortunately, the lack of character development made the story incredibly dull and predictable. Yui wakes up, wonders whereshe is, one of the vampire brothers appears and mocks her, then drinks her blood. The same repetition happening again and again with vague hints of character development and hidden storylines mixed in - but never explored to the extent needed to make sense. The vampires and Yui's backstories are also vague.


The male vampires were interesting. Their abusive behaviour cannot be justified, but understandable, in the sense that they loathe humanity and view humans as only livestock. Although, as stated earlier, there were hints of some sympathy from the vampires in different situations for Yui.

 It felt like throughout the series the vampire brothers just needed some persuasion, something from the main character besides her blood to create a better plotline. Unfortunately, Yui's fragile status and personality made it impossible for there to be any true connection between her and the brothers. She had no outside support, and had no self defense training, rendering her a useless blood bag.


Therefore, in the end. This anime has interesting characters, soundtrack, and artwork, but an incredibly cliche and dull story with no development. Best to stick with fanfics if you want any reprieve from this terrible script.

*I would like to preface this with I have not played the games and this was my introduction to the series as a whole*
Well that was absolutely dreadful. I am not sure who thought it was a good idea to turn a dating sim into an anime but they really did not think it through very well. In visual novel style you have some control over the path that you take and the characters at least stand a chance of development and growth. There is time allotted for you to develop an interest in the characters, the plot, and the romance. Without the ability tochoose that path all you are left with is cheap pandering torture porn that is not even well done. 


As far as the art is concerned, I actually really liked it. That is the main thing that drew me to this dumpster fire of a production. The characters are genuinely attractive to look at. 


The sound is okay I suppose although it does sound like you are watching a cheap low quality hentai during many scenes. Lots of dramatic breathing, screaming, and moaning. 


The characters are hard to rate as you do not get the opportunity to learn really anything about them besides the fact that they are a harem of brothers that happen to be vampires. I will say that the anime makes you want to know more about certain characters and that may lead you to delve into the numerous games involving them but the anime itself is really lacking in the character department. They are just blank empty shells thrusting abuse in every direction. 


My enjoyment of this series was very limited. There is one character that peaked my interest and the art is nice enough but that is really where my enjoyment stopped. If you are a masochist you may enjoy projecting yourself onto the blank slate of the heroine, if you are a sadist that likes to watch women suffer you may find yourself projecting yourself onto one of the numerous abuse inflicting vampires on screen, and if you are a fan of oh so edgy harems you may enjoy the premise of it. 


If you found yourself enjoying this, even if just enjoying the idea of the premise, I advise and implore you to check out the games and other source materials. This anime is garbage but the rest does not have to be. I will likely not take my own advice as this anime ruined it for me.

Actually watched this anime back in 2014, only bothered to write a review now haha
This is coming from a big fan of the series who has done and seen everything involving the series, so listen closely: THE ANIME SUCKS.
Why? There is little to no plot. Seriously, every episode is just them abusing the protagonist--Yui. And in every episode, one of them will suck her blood. Sure, the art is pretty and all, but the plot only emerges in the last few episodes of the anime. And it gets resolved in said episodes. The characters are charming sadistic pricks, who are displayed terribly, but even so,they're probably the only reason why this anime has fans.


The anime is an adaptation of the otome game. And I'm going to state the obvious: The games are 100% better than the anime. They dragged me back into this hell, and I unintentionally fell for it. Only problem for people who want to play the game is that its only Japanese, no English subtitles. Otherwise, the games are actually pretty enjoyable, they did a much better job displaying the characters (and that's because you can choose to focus on one character) and the games actually did have a plot written. I had a lot of fun. So if you really want to enjoy this series, and you can read Japanese sentences (With lots of Kanji), then go play the games.


 A lot of fans you see aren't going to say this, because most seem to come from the anime for some questionable reason, but the reality is: the anime is absolutely no good. Its absolute garbage. I wish they did a better job on it. 


I'd recommend skipping it if you enjoy anime with actual plot. 

Hell, I probably wouldn't recommend even if you do like sadistic vamps. Because this is just plain bad.

Right off the bat I have to warn you: this isn't a romance, nor is it tagged as one here on MAL. Most of us fangirls jump to the conclusion it /has/ to be one, considering it's the typical reverse harem scenario with the vampire twist to it, but this anime never claims to be romantic, thankfully so. All of the interactions between the female lead and the vampires is anything but romantic nor ideal, they're mysoginistic and lack consent and they're overall terrible examples for how boys should behave around girls. But they didn't have to be, because again, this isn't meant to bea love story.


In fact, I'd consider this anime a somewhat failed attempt at a horror flick, even if it has its creepy moments. It doesn't involve any jumpscares or overall tense situations like most generic horror plots nowadays, but instead it focus on extremely condemning actions carried out by all of the vampire leads. I think the best attempt at horror in the whole show is Kanato's character, he's creepy right off the back and there is never any hidden meanings behind his interactions with the female lead besides genuinely terrifying scenarios. If all vampires had the same athmosphere as he did, this show would have been better and we might have even been able to consider it a genuine attempt at horror. Sadly, you mostly get more non-con scenarios than the ones involving Kanato, so there's a lot of lost potential in that area.


Now, I didn't finish the anime, mostly because I got bored. There wasn't enough focus on Kanato to keep me going as a fan of horror, so the show quickly became dull. But I can say that there is definitely a small niche for Diabolik Lovers. If you love characters that give you the creeps from how borderline insane they are, you're going to enjoy Kanato. Sadly, you're not really going to enjoy much else. And if you're looking for any sort of romance, don't bother watching, because you're not going to find any.


I'd just like to finish by saying I understand everyone condemning the vampires in their reviews, because they're behaviour is abominal, however I feel like everyone's still seeing them as potential romantic interests to the female lead, hence why it's so harshly judged. If you regard Diabolik Lovers as a somewhat creepy cautionary tale on the whole vampire craze we had a couple of years ago, you quickly realize the fact everyone is so reprehensable is one of the best parts of the anime. There was no sugarcoating the vampire fantasy. There were no indications girls should aspire to experience what Yui did. It was just out there for us to judge for ourselves because they knew how terrible the vampires were being and I think that's how you should regard this series as well.

Let me be honest, I enjoyed this anime. Wait right there! I am not done yet. I completely agree with other reviewers, this anime is not a good one. Not at all, but that doesn't mean it doesn't have its appeal. I want to say the male characters are all the yandere type, but they don't really seem to care about the protagonist at all. She's basically food to them. They are aggressive, verbally abusive, and deplorable. If there was any sex in this anime, it'd be down right rape time and time again, but of course, there is none, but you get what Imean, right?

I enjoy kabe-don and aggressive guys. I won't lie, my heart jumped when I saw the first few episodes. I've read a lot of smut out there and you know what? Rape or forcing yourself on a girl is apparently a big thing, so yeah, I can't be mad at this anime for providing Japanese girls/women with the excitement that they like. Hell, I'll take it from time to time.

However, after you get into this for a while, you notice how thin the plot line is. There's barely a plot. I watched all 12 episodes and the parts with "action" don't really make sense to me and it's resolved rather quickly. Yeah, I think this anime is about the fan service.

Everyone gets mad that this anime is about a bunch of vampires that violate the protagonist over and over. Well, you know what? Brother's Conflict is like that too, without all of the sex sounds (i.e. slurping blood). They're vampires so I assume it's supposed to appeal to the inner pervert in women. Like it or not, there's a market out there for it. Especially if you're sexually frustrated.


Anyway, the characters are more or less....shallow? You get a small glimpse into what makes some of them tick, but not entirely. There is so much hate amongst them all. I think there's a shota in this anime (which doesn't make sense since they're triplets...How did one manage to stay tiny?) and he just terrifies me. He's the most violent of them all. The megane character is just plain annoying. He yells at the main character for everything from bad table manners (even though all of his brothers just left the table or were entirely rude) and breaking something after he did something to her. What the hell is that? This is like the opposite of brother's conflict: everyone hates everyone else and is violent and mean to the main character. 


The artwork? Well, that's pretty much where this anime excels. The artwork is beautifully done. The sound is pretty decent, but nothing to write home about, but what makes an anime is the plot and the characters. If you can't like the characters, you can't invest yourself in it! 


Overall, I enjoyed myself a fair amount. Like I said, there's a market for this type of aggressive and violent love (?!) affair. If the characters actually showed any type of compassion for the main character, maybe it'd be more enjoyable. I hope the sequel will be better.

I kept seeing adds for this and liked the look of the art so I decided to give it a try.
I've played Ootome games and really wondered how they were going to make an anime out of one without picking a clear route (generally if you don't pick a character right off the bat then you get a bad ending).
The story line with this was rather garbled and I felt like there's so many things that could have used more explanation (and have been really interesting).
I guess we were seeing Ayato's route to some extent but it just didn't feel complete. He had some charactergrowth but not much.\n\n
The premise was amusing and I like the return to more "traditional" vampires (i.e. human=food or toy not necessarily love interest).\n\n
The game probably makes more sense (and I'd be interested to play it) but since it's not available in English I kind of wish they'd make a second season of the anime just to tie up all the lose ends from the first season.\n\n
Overall it's sadistic fluff

Story: 4/10 *May Contain Spoilers*
Summary: Diabolik Lovers takes place in a creepy old castle in the middle of nowhere. The main character is a young girl named Yui whose father just drops her off to live in this mysterious castle. Upon her arrival, she finds out that she will be living with six blood lusting vampires.
Okay where do I start with this story? It definitely isn’t for everyone. The whole thing starts off entirely predictable. 6 good looking vampires all want to drink from our female heroine. And being your typical female anime character, she lets them. Pretty much the entire first 6-8 episodes (thereare only 12) is just her wandering around this castle running into these guys and them demanding that she let them suck her blood. That’s it. They are cruel and nasty to her but after days of living in this place, Yui continues to let them physically and emotionally abuse her. It isn’t until nearly the very end when you actually get told what why she’s there or what’s actually going on. (I won’t spoil that for anyone who chooses to watch). The story could have been made better but they just didn’t develop it enough. 


Characters: 3/10


Okay, the characters are one of the more pathetic things about this anime. First I’ll start with Yui. Like I said previously, she’s in this house, she clearly doesn’t like the fact that these vampires are abusing her but she keeps letting it happen. For heaven’s sake one of them even gives her the opportunity to leave and he decides to stay because she’s curious about what’s going on. Yui legit has zero growth in this show. She’s just a static, pathetic blob. The rest of the characters are these six brothers. I won’t go into detail on each one because that would be pointless. But the only way I can describe them is that they are glorious assholes. They do as they please to Yui and they really don’t care about her feelings at all. They treat her like a slave. One of them continually calls her a derogatory name and she never once gets angry at him for it. I kept waiting for one of them to show her a little bit of kindness. Like perhaps a knight in shining armor amongst all of the rest of them. But there wasn’t. At the end you get the impression that one of them might have some feelings for her but they’re still selfish feelings, not ones with Yui in mind at all. Again, none of the brothers ever show any real growth. They never feel any remorse for what they have done in their past (which you will see if you watch) and they only care about themselves. They don’t even really seem to care about each other. The only reason I didn’t give the characters a lower score was because I thought the writers did an excellent job of portraying them as such wicked people.


Music 7/10


The music was one of the more redeeming factors in this anime. It fit the macabre theme really well. It was one of the things that helped me get into the cliche one dimensional story. The theme song was pretty good too. Especially the music they use in the first episode. 


Along with music I’m just going to add in something about sound. I want to warn anyone considering watching this anime that there is an absurd amount of disgusting slurping and sucking sounds when the vampires are biting Yui. It really got on my nerves. It sounded more like they were biting into a crisp apple.


Animation 8/10


The animation and the art style in this anime was definitely its best quality by far. Everything is beautifully drawn and animated. It’s a reverse harem anime so the boys in it, while evil to the core are quite pretty to watch. Also if you love the whole gothic style this anime will definitely fulfill your fancy. Though if the art style is the only thing that will catch your eye then it’s probably not worth your time.


Overall: 5/10


If the animation hadn’t been as good as it was I would have scored this a bit lower. I really don’t recommend this anime to anyone who doesn’t like the vampire genre, reverse harem, stupid main characters or lots of blood. I will say that for whatever reason it deep keep me watching which was a good thing I guess. I marathoned it in less than 24 hours. It’s twelve episodes and they’re only 14 minutes long so it goes pretty fast. So if you’re curious it won’t be a complete waste of time. If you like English dubbed the entire series is on Youtube in one video. And if you watch it and like it,  Season 2 airs this October (2015) and there is an OVA.

The only way anyone can enjoy this anime is if they were to look at it as a horror anime (which was how I was able to give it a four). But you have to be able to get past the immense abuse the main character is put through. And get past the fact that the title says "Lovers" and all the guys are sadistic masochists who get off on fear and inflicting pain. Yui is barely even treated like a human being, but rather a piece of food. There's nothing remotely romantic about that.
The only thing that keeps you watching is the constant unknownof who Yui really is and other mysteries throughout. And I enjoyed the art (except for Yui's hair, the ombre effect was a little odd).


I also was intrigued by how the brothers kept having flashbacks whenever Yui touched them or interacted with them in some way, but that kept ending in them drinking her blood. They even went as far as to try to make Ayato's seem romantic and started to show his last bit of humanity... before he drank her blood even though he knew she was drowning (but as soon as he kissed her she suddenly wasn't struggling for air anymore???). 


The show had potential, truly, but it fell flat and I don't have much desire to go further. Of course, I still want to know who Yui is, who was the woman in the window, etc etc, but I feel like my time could be better spent. If they had drawn from the one moment of Ayato's humanity came through and continued playing on that, this really could have gone somewhere, but with where it's going now they're all manipulative, possessive, abusive animals who see Yui as a blood bag (and that's all the writers saw her as too, or so it seems). I wasn't expecting the vampires to be extremely kind to her like this was some Twilight remake, but I also wasn't expecting the entire show so far to be based around them getting off on her pain and that really be it for them (besides their pent up hatred). Just something to make it a bit more worthwhile to watch and less like I'm watching a potential rape scene every five minutes.


Also Laito's little nickname for Yui is so overused it's ridiculous. Use it once, fine, but he didn't need to use every single time he addressed her.

Essentially a Dating Sim turned Anime, this features your typical story of a single boy/girl being forced to live with/live near a large group of the opposite gender. Only this takes a much more disturbing turn when she's sent 'from the church' to be a 'prospective bride', though she's never told of this. Instead the main character is simply told 'Hey, we're sending you to this place to live. Bye."
No, not because the characters are vampires. That's not a problem at all. It's due to the fact that the male cast all openly abuse the main female character in every. Single. Episode. Pushing her, yankingher about, strangling her, calling her worthless and pathetic, laughing when she falls, playing mind games, and oh, did I mention talking about draining her and having her stuffed and mounted while draining her in a room full of women that had been previously drained, stuffed and mounted like taxidermist pieces? One of the characters even makes a habit of calling the main character "Bitch-chan". And the biting. Let's not forget the biting. Everyone bites her at least once it seems.


Of course she does stay. And she puts up with their abuse because obviously, if she gets to know them things will get better! :I Right. And no, it doesn't. There's absolutely no character growth and we find out very, VERY little about all of the characters. Most of the buildup and climax happens during the last few episodes and it really isn't much of a payoff. Not enough to justify sitting through so much abuse.


The style of animation is alright but somehow seems cheap. like it was done in colored pencil or something. The sound is fine, though some of the sound effects are a bit weird (rain drops on concrete sound like a dripping faucet in a metal sink?).


If you can tolerate the abuse, poor excuse for a 'story', weird apple crunching while biting necks (and other body parts), and the abuse.... yeah, no. I wouldn't recommend this to a soul. Just no.

I close friend of mine highly recommended me an anime entitled 'Diabolik Lovers', the title itself says that there's gonna be a handful of romance. My theory of 'romance' as one of it's genre wasn't all that true, rather it was mostly suspense and vampire. Before watching the anime, the same friend told me to read 'Diabolik Lovers Anthology' manga. I found myself lost and furious, 'why is she not defending herself?!' the words kept circling around my head..I soon cutoff from reading it and heck with the manga, I watched the anime. 
Story [5] -- I'm not really a big fan of vampire themedanimes, and Diabolik Lovers is one reason why I still dislike the genre.The story isn't all cliche, it had it's own mix to it. For instance, the mysterious woman that Yui saw at the end of episode one and how will the brothers deal with their uncontrollable lust for human blood. But one of the many reasons why I don't like it is because (i think) the pace was a bit too fast were in I couldn't catch up. The fact that Yui ended up in a place where she wasn't much welcomed and she was somehow naive throughout the whole anime! I also disliked the way she acts when she is being bitten by one of the vampires, she doesn't even make much effort to stop them--it's like she is enjoying it very much! She may not have a big chance to stop being bitten but she should at least show an effort! I skipped a few episodes so I can't say much of the story, but from my point of view, it isn't that special.


Art [7] -- The art is fitting to the atmosphere of the anime, dark and suspense. From the gate of the mansion to the rest of the backgrounds, it really was stunning.  All of them were drawn  ideally except Subaru's eyes on his hair and a few other points. The character design is okay but it could be improved--were in they will not look like a Korean boy band.The animation isn't that special, it's just average.


Sound [9] -- I honestly didn't payed much attention to the soundtrack, it wasn't the best I've heard but it's good. 


Characters  [8]-- I somehow didn't like how some characters acted, though I feel horrible for Yui. Every vampire acted like a bad ass and they would scare the hell out of Yui about wanting to suck her blood, it was an average vampire attitude. Though I would like to point out how cool and awesome Shu is. :3


Enjoyment [3] -- Sorry but I didn't had much fun, I simply had a poker face on while watching. It was either because I'm a heartless spawn of satan or I just don't like the flow of the anime. But this is just an opinion, half of the people I knew who watched this got addicted over this anime.


Overall [2] -- Unfortunately, Diabolik Lovers did not contain that special element that would (somehow) change my perspective on the vampire genre. At the end of the day Diabolik Lovers is just one good art with reverse harem written all over it.

Okay, so before I watched this series, I'd seen multiple images posted online and people in general saying how it was a pretty good anime, but how bitterly disappointed was I when I actually decided to watch the series. The whole of Diabolik Lovers was incredibly difficult to watch due to the nonexistent character development, essentially nonexistent plot line and very basic artwork which came together to make this one of the most unbearable series I've yet to encounter. 
Going into more detail, this series tried and failed in attempting to successfully use the commonly misused harem technique, and gave up on bothering to havea plot and instead just cheaply featured the relatively hot boys which didn't do much and couldn't express their feelings well, and because of the lack of character development, this was all they did. 


I was also particularly disappointed by the main female protagonist, who was quite literally the embodiment of a sexist depiction of the 'damsel in distress' and couldn't stand on her own two feet. She added nothing to the story, and as the series progressed, she didn't change at all, but rather remained the same as at the beginning. 


However, I must stress the point that the idea behind Diabolic Lovers was an interesting concept and  relatively original, but it was destroyed by the lack of character development and terrible plot line.

I personally loved this show. Yeah many people hated this show with a passion but to me it merely shows that it was able to stir emotion in people, whether good or bad. I loved Laito even tho the whole Bitch-Chan thing was annoying at times, and yes the girl was abused by each brother but what were u guys expecting? A 12 episode series with vampires and a girl holding hands and skipping merrily? Be realistic and know what type of series your about to get in to. Yes the plot was very little explained and the backgrounds for the characters weren't in depthbut I was still able to get the gist of it by reading the game summaries and the character backgrounds. Overall I agree it could have been much better but it did in fact catch my interest and the boys were truly amazing in sadist/sinful ways but that's what makes people talk about them. So I think the creators did their jobs because we're still talking about it and reviewing it....god or bad.

If you were to describe this show with two words, it would definitely be either "car crash" or "train wreck", for it is a truly dreadful scenario that you can't stop looking at (for some odd reason). 
By combining the very popular (and cheerful) themes of sadism, masochism, misogyny, slavery and rape in the worst possible manner, this thing makes Twilight (hell, even Fifty Shades of Grey!) seem like a masterpiece. Although the genre is labelled as "shoujo", this giant mess can't really decide who it's aimed at, and what emotions it wants to evoke. While its few fans may praise it for combining "horror","eeriness", and "creepiness", the reality is that the only feeling this thing can evoke from viewers who still have their sanity is undoubtedly disgust. From the endless slurping sounds to the sexual innuendos and rape references to the story (or lack of) in general, you will spend your time wondering as to

1) Why did I ever start watching this crap? 

2) Will it ever get better? 


While there may be no viable answer for the first question, I can guarantee you that this show never gets better, develops a plot, or even has a logical ending that will explain the little bits of "mystery" that may have kept you watching till the end. 


As if that wasn't enough, the characters are completely unlikeable and unrelatable,  with every single one of the vampires being evil and sadistic and the protagonist being truly pathetic (maybe they kept saying that she was totally worthless and nicknamed her Little Bitch for a reason). Unsurprisingly, all your hope for character and plot development will also quickly die away, for as soon as you start thinking that one of the vampires will do something different, they always prove you wrong and continue to 

1) bite the girl 

2) hear her protesting (quite pathetically) for 2 seconds, and 

3) proceed to tell her to shut up. 


This experience is enhanced with the slurping and licking sounds mentioned above, as well as an extremely generic OST which sounds like a cheap ripoff from Yuki Kajiura. 


Like most people who got into this mess, you may probably think that this anime does have a single redeeming quality - its art. While that may appear to be true initially, you will eventually realize that there is no point in watching a story that combines such great art with such horrible execution (and actually kills off some of your brain cells in the process). 


Overall, this is an appalling show to watch and should be avoided like the plague. However, if you do decide to watch "Diabolik Lovers" (or "Rape Race", as I like to call it), be warned that you will not even be able to feel pity for the useless main character or the sadistic supporting ones. The only people to pity here are those who had to provide their voices for this crap as well as those who had to endure all of its faults while watching it. 


PS: You've been warned. Here's to 3 hours of your life that you'll never get back.

Well, I binge watched this whole anime and I have almost nothing good to say about it after finishing. The art style is pretty cool, I thought it was pretty good and I usually like this kind of art style, and it's got pretty solid voice acting. Buuuut that's pretty much where my enjoyment for it ends.
Wow, I hated almost every single one of these characters. First of all, the main girl, Yui, is a little Mary Sue pushover that doesn't have an inkling of a personality let alone willpower. At first I felt bad for her but as the show went on, I completelylost all sympathy for her and she just began irritating me everytime I saw her. She does ABSOLUTELY nothing the entire show, even when she gets a chance to do something and change her situation, What does she do? Zip! I know that this was from an otome game and that's why she's pretty much a blank slate but it wouldn't hurt to make her likable or relatable.(sigh) 


Now let's talk about the so called "vampires". Now I have to admit I ended up liking one or two of them a little bit by the end of the show, but it just didn't help me like the show anymore overall, even with the two out of, what? Six? None of them had any character development to speak of, the prick that they were at the beginning of the show is the same prick they'll be at the ending, and most of them are just huge douchbags with no redeemable qualities, Why the hell am I going to root for them?(But then again I wasn't rooting for Yui either so.) Every time I think they're going to do something even a little nice, it's quickly erased by whatever they say or do next.1 step forward 5 steps back is the motto of this show. 


"I found the story really intriguing and couldn't get enough of it." Is what I wish I could say here >,< I actually would talk about the story now if I thought there was one. It was just Yui getting passed around the guys like a bag of chips and a who could treat her the douchiest contest all up until the second or third to last episode. There wasn't any real story and the story at the end was so rushed and uninteresting that I forgot about most of it as soon as it was over.


Many people told me that the game was a lot better than this so I looked into it and read about the story and characters on the game sites and wikia. I also watched some game clips, just cause I like to torture myself >.< But I have to agree with them, it seems like a pretty decent game from what I read and watched, so I don't know why this anime was so god awful. You know your anime has failed when reading about it online has more story and character development than watching it. So if you for some reason want to watch this I suggest playing the game and not wasting your time with this, you'll get a lot more out of it.
