So the series is about Yui Komori,a young girl who is sent to live in a mansion by her father.She lives with these six brothers who are all vampires and drink her blood daily.
(THIS PART WILL CONTAIN SPOILERS)
Honestly writing this review because I have nothing better to do at the moment :P.This anime used to be my shit when I was in 6th grade ,but now looking back at it I have concluded that it is shit.Honestly the protagonist is pushed around so easily and has no character whatsoever (I mean the anime's main purpose is giving us vamp boy fan service...somehow).In the first episodewhen Ayato pushes her down on the couch so he can be on top of her to drink her blood she doesn't even fucking react shes just like "O no please don't do this" and yet doesn't even attempt to get away from him.Later she discovers the boys are vampires she fucking trips on nothing while trying to run and instead of getting up she pulls out a fucking cross instead of  running.Later in the series Subaru literally hands her a silver knife so she can kill the brothers (even him if needed) and escape .AND SHE STAYS.There are honestly a million dumb that this girl has done and it's annoying ,there is nothing to enjoy about her character.Now let's talk about the boys . Except the fact that they are all sadistic and problematic characters their backstories make them at least sympathetic and explains the reasons why they are like that and it makes you feel for them.This anime has no plot or character development ,I don't even think there was a plot and even if there was one it was boring and forgettable,personaly I don't remember any plot.You might say that there was an improvement in the last episode when they "care" for Yui and try to save her  .The fuckers just want her blood ,not her.The only character who I deem just a little bit sane in this god forsaken anime is Subaru ,coz you know,he actually tries to help our shit for brains main character and doesn't want to drink her blood,tho not because he cares for this girl ,she just reminds him of his mother,just a little bit tho and he also doesn't want to accept her because his father brought Yui as a sacrificial bride (even tho he does drink her blood like twice out of his instinct )but even he is a really problematic character.I do not now about the game or how good or bad it is but this anime is just too terrible.Also I am surprised that this girl doesn't die on the first three episodes because of the large amounts of blood  she looses or doesn't have anemia at the end of the series.\n
To sum it all up :\n
This anime has shitty and problematic characters,tons of sexual abuse ,no plot at all for which even the art (that is actually not bad) and the decent voice acting can't make up for.Do not watch this anime ,you'll only waste your time even if you end up enjoying it.

First time doing a review...so lets give it a shot...
I appreciate Reverse Harem anime, it's a breathe of fresh to show that girls actually have a selection of guys to choose from instead of the guys always having the limelight. Me and my girlfriend gave this a shot.....
WORST. DECISION. EVER!!!
Ok, maybe not THESE worst, but this anime is a kind of masochistic stupid that only people who like 50 Shades of Grey could enjoy...All of the males are fucking assholes, the girl is just to much of a damn damsel to do anything about it, and.......well...it's like this....
Just like Mahou Sensei Negima is the AnimeEquivalent of Harry Potter, Diabolic Lovers is the Anime Equivalent of Twilight! The resemblance is freakin' frightening! \n\n
Bottom line, if you are seeker of reverse harem anime, then take this one and turn the other cheek

I regret watching this anime. I regret it so much. After reading all the bad reviews on this site, I figured, why not? It can't be THAT bad. Right?
WRONG. So wrong. There are a lot of thing wrong with this show, so let's start with the story. SO MANY SPOILERS! AND CURSING! (I am VERY passive-aggressive about this crap show. Well, not really passive.)
Story; There is none. Really. All you see is a girl getting vampire-raped (and possibly actual raped) repeatedly by vampires. There's even a freaking bloodsucking rape threesome. It was honestly terrifying. And then, when there are like 3 episodes left, they startputting in all of this bullshit Oedipus crap. Freud would have ADORED this show. I think Yui got possessed by their mom, and hooked up with the uncle? Or something? All I know is that the mom started making out with her stepson and it was disgusting.


Art: The one saving grace. The art probably deceived so many people into thinking this would be a good anime. I mean, the vampire dudes are actually pretty hot, and the heroine is pretty. The clothes and backgrounds have nice, interesting design. It LOOKS like a good anime. But it is not. It is not.


Sound: Forgettable. the op was typical reverse harem, all the guys singing at you. Creepy. I ignored the ed. And the voice acting was mildly painful, as they must have forced the actors to be in the show. Good actors. Sad. And a heads-up, there is constant slurping and licking sounds that will send shivers up your spine, but in a bad way. I would say to mute it, but it is CONSTANT.


Character; Where to begin?

Yui (the heroine); Spineless and stupid. When she realizes that she is essentially trapped in a horrific Twilight x 50 Shades of Grey parody, the first thing she does is call her dad, not 911. To be specific, her father, the one who sent her to this hell. And she is so stupid. She has the opportunity to escape, and she goes to a church. Really? Not the cops? You can pray just as well in a police station, dearie. And can I mention the fact that she doesn't even struggle when they suck her blood? Like, not even a little. And apparently she is a magical blood bag, because I'm pretty sure she died from blood loss in the first episode. unless of course, she drank some of that elixir from Baccano, which would explain how NONE OF THOSE BITE MARKS STAY ON HER BODY LONGER THAN 3 SECONDS. And when that idiot gave her a vampire-killing knife, she didn't use it on him immediately. Or on any of the brothers. At all. I feel like she probably liked living there. Masochist.


I cannot remember half of those vampires names, but here I go;


Laito (aka, Hat bastard); I hate this guy so much. Maybe the hat was a hint that he was a sack of shit. Literally as soon as she gets into the house, he picks probably the most insulting possible name for her. 'Little bitch'. He just starts calling her that, for THE ENTIRE SHOW. And did I mention he rapes her in a church? Because I am 101% sure he does. And Yui literally does not care that she'd being raped, but she complains that he's doing it in a church.  WHAT KIND OF HUMAN BEING GIVES A SHIT WHERE THEY ARE BEING RAPED! A normal person would say; STOP RAPING ME. But she says: 'You can't do that in a church! It's sacrilegious!' I hate that bastard. 


Ayato (aka rapist bastard); He is (quite obviously) the love interest. Even though, he constantly drinks her blood, threatens her, and actually once tries to drown her. And then sucks her blood underwater. There are so many things wrong with this show, but one thing I must point out; he forces her to skip class and make food for him. Human food. And then he eats it, and clearly enjoys eating it. And the other brothers are seen eating human food. So why the hell do they have to suck her blood? I think it's because they all hate her. I hate this SOB too. Literally, he is a son of a bitch, because his mom is a bitch. Also, don't roll up one pant leg, you prick. Roll them both or neither. it makes you look like a drooling incompetent who can't dress himself.


Glasses bastard; Super sadist. He doesn't care if the main character gets raped, as long as it's in their bedroom. He threatened to whip her. Really? This is like five minutes after you threatened to kill her. Make up your damn mind. Freak. 


Insane shota bastard; He talks to his fucking teddy bear. He stabbed his potatoes to death. He fell off the roof and (sadly) didn't die. Need I say more? He is an insane, 12 year-old looking bastard. I hate him.


Sleeping headphone bastard; Is somewhat more tolerable, if only because he has less screentime. But in his screentime, he makes sure to make you despise him. Wears headphones in the bath because he's that fucking edgy. Can I mention that dumbass heroine actually went to this guy for help once? And to NO ONES surprise, he sucked her blood. And she was surprised. Really? And this was like the 10th episode. She should have seen that shit coming, honestly. I hate this guy. Fuck you and your headphones. Lazy ass.


Obligatory anger issues bastard; gives the heroine a vampire-killing knife, but she is too stupid and does not immediately stab him with it. Gives the heroine a chance to escape, but she's too stupid and stays for some fucking reason. Punches walls a lot. Attacks rose bushes. Stay classy, asshole. 


 I hope this gives you an idea of how shitty everyone is in this story.


Enjoyment; Not even. I actually felt like I was dying approaching the end of the show. I felt so hopeless...


 But then the show ended and I could breath again. I wish there were negative ratings on this site. I mean initially, I laughed because I was seeing so much rapey everything that is was dumb, but then it just got annoying and cringey.


Overall: Don't make my mistake. Don't watch this show. Unless you are a masochist/like rapey undertones. Then please, watch as much as possible. I give this show a 1, only because -9001 isn't a rating on this site.

Watching Diabolik Lovers made me say "I guess there are stories worse than Twillight after all".
This is the worst kind of anime you could ever find. Diabolik Lovers is the most stupid anime that I have ever watched. I never knew there could possibly be this stupid animes out there. I don't even know where to start.
Each episode is 14 minutes long (thank god). There's that oh-so-innocent main character that everyone wants to f*** . With her stupid dumbfounded look , shrieking voice and non stop screaming and running. 
Other characters all have different personalities which is why everyone finds their favourite one very easily,but then again there's that one that ends up with protagonist.\n\n
If you could summarize all the things that repeatedly happen in this anime the most annoying and common one would be "ahhh no" [exposes neck and puts up no fight whatsoever]. \n
And if you could summarize all my reactions during watching this anime it would be "tsk [biggest eyeroll]"\n\n
My overall score is f***ing lower than the one I put on Boku no Pico , and that is 1.

I really don't have much to say about this anime. The series was just a waste of time. Literally. It has no meaning. It has no point. Characters are just horrible. The main character in this series is so naive and not in a good way. It's just annoying. 
I only watched this anime because no matter what i love reverse harems. And generally i don't expect much from reverse harems. But this series is unacceptable. And there's no such a thing as "character development" in the anime. I recently watched "Dance with the Devils" and was way better than this.
And one last thing, whenit's something about vampires, we expect something different, something new. The story is boring and common. One girl and a bunch of boys who wants to suck her blood. Really? Are we supposed to enjoy this? \n\n
If you want to be bored to death, watch this.

I was appalled when I saw how many hate reviews this anime has. To start off, the main problem everyone has with this is how the guys are abusive toward the protagonist. If any of you even bothered to do a bit of research into this anime before watching it, you would have known what to expect. 
Yes, the guys are abusive and sick. Yes, it is disturbing. But it's a very good reality check! In other vampire anime, the vamps are love-sick, sweet, and nice people. VAMPIRES ARE FUCKING BLOOD-SUCKING MONSTERS! They're not supposed to be soft and sweet. I like that about thisanime. Reality check for all you idiots.

Now, moving on.



Story.

Rating: 7/10


The story isn't the most original as far as vampire anime go. With the protagonist 'awakening' and all, that was pretty cliche. But what I liked about it was that the characters were all included in the story line, with their pasts related to the plot. Some of you have said that the story has no plot, but the plot only develops AFTER the characters are properly introduced, unlike some poorly structured stories. Anyway, moving on.


Art.

Rating: 10/10


The art of this anime was probably the reason most of us decided to watch it. The hair gradient is awesome, as well as the unique eyes each of the characters have. The colours are very well done, and the art style is beautiful. Of course, having all the characters being extremely hot helps too. ;3

I think I don't need to explain more, 'cause all of you know how great the art is. So, next.


Sound.

Rating: 8/10


The music. Nice and eerie. It really helped create the atmosphere in this anime. The opening music was stereotypical vampire anime music, but I liked it. Also, the title of the song was called, "Mr Sadistic Night" It really matches the anime well. Again, another clue that you people should have known that it wasn't a sweet and friendly anime >:(

The characters voices sounded very good; they really suited the character they were voicing. Especially Kanato. Nice and creepy. 


Character.

Rating: 9/10


The characters had very distinctive personalities (except for Yui). And the best thing about it is that they all had a reason why there personality was like that. With their tragic pasts. The characters were excellently designed, and they are all hot. VERY hot. But, back to the personality thing. This anime shows, through the characters, that what happens in the past can define who you will be in the future. Their separate personalities are due to their traumatising pasts.


Enjoyment.

8/10


This anime was very exciting. Don't take that the wrong way. I just found it very gripping and I was left on edge a couple of times, waiting to see what would happen. It's a thriller. That describes it perfectly. I really enjoyed watching it.


Overall.

Rating: 8/10


This anime is one-of-a-kind. I've never seen one like it. It's a nice reality check, strange as far as harem goes, and the characters are amazing, both in appearance and personality. This anime chilled me to the bone, and disturbed me. Just as it disturbed EVERYONE. But guess what? That's the freaking PURPOSE! It's meant to have impact! And it does! I feel sorry for all the haters who can't recognise a gem of an anime when they see one.


Note: I apologise if you are offended by anything I have said. I can be quite opinionated when reviewing an anime. Thank you for reading this.

This show...no this horrible show is beyond my comprehension of a shojou show. This is no longer a shojou show or whatsoever because I am going to explain my point. Firstly we shall explain the bad points shall we? (cause I cant wait)
 However I saw the light at the end of the tunnel. A small light with its so called intriguing plot.
STORY -4
What can I say? There was hardly any background information about the main character and we are just mysteriously thrown into a castle to start the show. (dont go in there...psst)  Well, the first I dont know half or three quarterof the freaking show was about the poor heroine being sucked out of her blood for all of the sadistic brother's entertainment. How "sweet". IT AINT. ITS SO DISGUSTING THE WAY THEY TREAT HER AND OK...now the reason why there is a light at the end of the tunnel. Well I highly suggest not to watch this show unless you can withstand it or your just bored and wanted some horrible anime to watch so I'm just going to state it here. If you plan to watch skip this story section. The interesting part was really who our heroine was. It got me motivated to keep watching the show and how our casts so called began to be concern (im not joking. JUST) and how to get rid of this Cordelia (who is horrible too). I rather enjoyed the so called plot during the last few episodes. BUT THIS DOES NOT SAVE THE SHOW FROM ITS NASTY INTRODUCTION AND FOLLOWING EPISODES WHICH FELT LIKE A DECADE. I WAS OFTEN LEFT WITH "what?". I was hardly satisfied with the ending (worse ending with no one decided AT ALL) and I dont see a happy ending for her. At least the good part was what this whole thing about Yui got into.


ART -7

The art direction here is decent enough to get the job done. Nothing too flashy or to "wow" about. They also seem to like to blend white into the hair at the tip end where I have no reason why they did it but they did and eyes that can be seen through their hair. Animation is solid though and nothing felt weird at scenes (yes even the bite scenes...they did that better) . They used a lot of dark colours to bring out the eerie atmosphere which gets the job done.


SOUND -7

The sound is good but there was no noticeable tracks and it seems that all of the tracks prefers ochestra music except for the opening song. It gets its eerie atmosphere right and there really isn't much to say about it.


CHARACTER -1

This shows claim to be "shojou" but this wasn't. It was taken into such a sadistic world that you would feel pity for the heroine rather than supporting the male casts. The male casts are truly sadistic as they use Yui for their entertainment and blood source which was absolutely ridiculous. The whole three quarter of the show was like the whole male cast just sucking her blood and the plot just picks up towards the end. It is absolutely an insult to everyone to watch them just suck her blood while you can see that she is suffering and have problems but they just don't freaking care. Yui, our main heroine is rather empty. There is really no word to describe her except the fact that she is pathetic. She resists them for the first few episodes but she wants to stay with the male cast in the end?! EVEN THOUGH THEY TREATED HER SO BADLY?! Our male cast seem to enjoy torturing her every night and day just for her blood. Even Cordellia was such a horrible mother if you have read the spoilers in the character page of the male cast. No wonder. They don't even shed a bit of kindness towards our main character when she was clearly distressed about the truth and about herself and never help her when she needed the help towards the end. You would't root for one of them at all except for Ayato or Subaru who seems to be the only one to care for our heroine TOWARDS THE END. This show approaches the audiences in such a horrible and (excuse me) "bitchy" manner that you would feel disgusted with a cast they came up with.


ENJOYMENT -3

The story towards the end does not definitely save the show with its horrid introduction and episodes. It's only from episode 10 that the show had a plot. The rest of the show was just sadistic and horrible. From the cast to the story, IT WAS ALL HORRENDOUS EXCEPT FOR THE SOUND AND ART.


I WOULD NOT RECCOMEND U TO WATCH THIS SHOW JUST DONT UNLESS YOU GOT NOTHING TO DO. IM WARNING YOU.

I'm not sure why this anime was given such a low rating, I thought it was great! And by great, I mean hilarious~! 
As a reviewer who has not played the game or listened to the drama CD's, I feel that my review for the anime is less judgemental, and based more on the entertainment value that the TV series provides.  
I started watching this anime with a moderate amount of knowledge based on reviews I'd read for the video game.  The first episode immediately captured my attention due to the show's animation, which I found to be stunning.  The color's werespot on as I found them suitable given the show's atmosphere.


Next were the characters, and boy were they great eye candy,(cept for Kanato and Reiji...   -____-) especially since the art is so pretty.  


Compared to Amnesia's heroine, I thought DL's heroine was quite the doormat and dumb as well, but she had plenty of moments where she actually did try to resist the guys, despite them winning in the end.  So watching her was a lot more entertaining compared to Amnesia's emotionless and doll-like heroine.  


To be honest, I would love to see a second season featuring the Mukami? brothers or something like that.  I would definitely watch it.

To put it bluntly, this show is like buying a packet crisps at the shop and finding out it was filled with horse dung. 
If you are sensible you will hand it straight back to the shop you got it from and ask for a refund. 
If that isn't enough to put you off (aka me), then you will dig to the bottom of the packet, looking for some greater meaning behind it all, and you will find none.
Because this is what this anime is. If you strip away the pretty graphics, there is literally nothing going for it.
Initially it seemed okay. It tells thestory of Yui, a typical "shoujo" type character  who believes the world is made of marshmallows. She arrives at an undeniably nice looking mansion, the door opens, and she walks inside.


And that's where everything stopped being okay.


The first thing that happens is that she gets assaulted by a complete stranger. So, does she do something? No, of course she doesn't. She sits there, whining incessantly "Stop it!" or other lines similar to the example given. This happens with several guys, sometimes several in the same episode.


And that is essentially the entire story.

There is no more meaning to this, just like that crisp packet filled with horse dung.

There is a half-baked "plot twist" near the end, but it's hardly a twist, and doesn't do anything for the general story of this anime. It's still just a various selection of the men there finding new ways to invade her personal space.


Admittedly the art is very pretty. If you're anything like me, you saw the pretty boys and decided to watch it. After all, who doesn't like fairly handsome anime guys with gradient hair?


These guys are just dickwads.

Full stop.


No matter how "aristocratic" these guys are, their characters are terrible. There's a: 

-sadist who likes stabbing potatoes

-the eventual "lover" of the MC who continuously tries to rape the aforementioned MC

-the angry guy

-an analyst who holds no purpose other than to give foreboding messages to the MC

-the guy who does literally nothing but sleep or bite people

-and the pervert who nicknames the MC as "little bitch" and gets angry when she doesn't do exactly what he wants


That is all the character you will get out of these guys.

No, there is no character development.

Yes, all of them are unbearable assholes.

No, none of them have any depth whatsoever.


Well, you say, what about this "Main Character" you keep talking about?

Yui, the female protagonist, has about as much spine as a banana and as much personality as one, too.

If I'm going to be quite honest, she doesn't have a personality at all.

She spends the entire series being borderline raped by a variety of different men, and apparently does not have the strength to kick any of them in the balls although I must say that pretty much all of them deserved it.


Essentially all of these characters were wastes of fairly decent voice actors. Even if you decide not to look at the picture to prevent the loss of brain cells through overexposure to this, the admittedly attractive sounding voices are accompanied with awkward sucking noises like they don't understand the concept of drinking. The background music was mediocre at best, and I don't remember a single piece that held any special significance.


Overall this anime is only fit for either masochists or if you want to kill all your brain cells. It can also be used as a post-war urban torture practice if you need to get revenge on someone you truly hate.

I very much dislike this anime because of the simple fact that there aren't any interesting characters. The anime is basically a girl walking from room to room to get bit by a vampire.
she is bland, unlikable and all the dudes have the same back story which is none of thier paerent ever loved them. they all are dick heads and i got up to episode 7 and still thought it was getting started 
The EPISODES are only 12 minutes each which would be fine if they didn't cut out all of the character development... BUT i must say so all of the characters basicallyhad the same amount of screen time and they don't act in the way all anime characters do.

“Diabolik Lovers" is a horror anime based on the visual novel by Rejet. 
Yui is a girl who can see ghosts. Her father convinces her to move in with an old acquaintance of his because he has to move due to his new job. 
Yui finds out that the house's residents are six young men who just happen to be vampires. To make things 
worse, there's a secret in Yui's body that makes her blood a delicious treat to them. Will she survive?
Besides the fact that it should have been a 26 episode series, it also fails as a dark, edgy romance because most ofthe vampires act like abusive jerks to Yui. The only ones who show any kindness to her are Shu and Subaru. The anime fails to give the decent vampires the chance to develop a decent, \n\n
healthy romance with Yui. It's a shame because the anime does atmospheric horror well and the vampires' dark past have a great gothic feel. vampire fans should decide for themselves if they want to watch it or not\n

*Spoiler free*
From the start let's address the elephant in the room. Or why I won't give this a low score just because it's misogynistic(and yes it hell of is). Anime is art and the purpose of art is not to show us only pretty things we would like to see(duh...!). Handling aside I respect it for tackling such a taboo theme. I mean no one is trashing "12 Years a Slave" for displaying slavery so why trash this purely on the fact that it's misogynistic. So I will not score it 1 or 2 just because I dislike one of the main themes.
Premise, Plot
The premiseof the story is solid. We have a religious girl, churches, vampires and endless points of conflict. It's a pity that the solid base was wasted on a placeholder plot that was a pathetic cover for vampires bloodsucking a girl. And don't get me started on what's the bloodsucking a placeholder for. The whole thing was done in a retarded manner that was just wasteful.

Pacing

Well it's bad. From the start we have a different vampire "bloodsucking" the girl every episode. Then someone had the revelation that they needed an ending so they created one from there arses.

Complexity and Catharsis

The complexity is nonexistent, but then again you don't watch this anime for complexity. As for catharsis I was annoyed enough to write a review so.... some(I guess).

Conclusion

From the disappointing plot they actually got something that they can use in the future, but from it being a standalone it's again bad. Almost nothing changed in anyway for the heroine and the rest of the characters continued like - "well that happened blah,blah.....".


Characters 

Ok we have the main heroine Yui Komori and the vampires. Why vampires and not names? Well they barely have the personalities of secondary characters. They are stereotypical with everyone having different traits. And they are...

1. The I am so cool and aloof.

2. The smart I'll do everything type.

3.The possessive and aggressive one.

4.The retarded.

5.The playboy.

6.The only possibly good one as a character,at least for me, so I won't spoil him.

The antagonists thrown in there for the flimsy plot are not worth mentioning.

And here is our heroine Yui. Now I will allow myself to make a comparison. Think of Fantine from Les Miserables turn her character around in the worse possible manner and you got Yui. She is brain dead and I mean really it's wow. She could be seen as a masochist if you have a kind look on her character, but no..... she is just a really weak character that is there to be the object for the rape like scenarios.

As a whole the characters are horribly inconsistent. They behave against all reason established by their character which they cling to(exept Yui the poor bird is just stupid). Also there is virtually no development. At least the backdrop was sort of not terrible on the grand scheme of things.


Art and Sound

The art I loved. It is positively gorgeous. If only the anime was as good as it's visuals. The whole theme created by the art was what I wanted the anime to be. The sound wasn't bad, I found a bit unmemorable. The opening was alright and the ending was good.The bite sound was annoying as hell.


Enjoyment and Recommendation

I am giving it the benefit of the doubt that in the future it will get better and this whole season was just a character intro(I hope it is).

Did I enjoy it? Parts of it no matter how small they were.

Would I recommend it? . As anime it's bad like really bad one of the worse I have seen. Yet it tackles(even if in a horrible manner) taboo themes which you do not see everyday. I mean I watched the whole thing so it has to have some redeeming qualities like the art and it's really short too. 

As for recommending it, it's a resounding NO. There are definitely better things to watch and do, but at the end you decide.

I love this anime mostly because of the yandere male characters and the beautiful art. There really needs to be more anime with yandere male characters! (My favorite is Kanato!) :)
I think the portrayal of Yui is good because she always remains sweet and innocent. I wish the episodes were longer, though! 
I thought season 1 was better than season 2, but I still want them to make a season 3!!!
Even though I've watched all the episodes, I still like to read the manga and look  up youtube videos of the otome game. I wish they would make more manga too! AHH, make moreof everything!

Well, what to say about this anime?
I've read a lot of bad reviews, but also a few good one's.
This made me curious, but I prepared for the worst.
And, it was way better than I thought!
I read a lot about rape, well, I will make one thing clear, it's not rape! It's maybe something that looks like it, but it isn't, they don't go that far you know!
Story 8/10
The story is about a girl who ends up in a house with vampires. And, in contrast to other animes, they're not so nice to her. She is told that if she leaves the house she will bekilled. She also can't contact anyone, every phone she uses, is dead. Well, the boys are vampires so they suck her blood (How suprising -.-)

Later in the episodes there is some kind of an 'interesting' story, but you will see it for yourself :)


Art 9/10

The art reminded me kind of of the anime Amnesia, where the art was great!

But in Amnesia was it just a little bit better :)


Sound 8/10

Again, I don't really think the music is something that I listen to on purpose, so I wouldn't really know, I think it fitted quite well, because I wasn't irritated about it :) Then again, why an 8? Well, I liked the opening!


Character 9/10

Some people would totally disagree with me that the persons in the anime have an own character, but they do have one.

Yui:she just lets everything happen to her, but she well, she does actually resist, but she's just to weak :) but she doesn't actually have a very strong personnallity.

Well, I won't tell to much, but I liked Ayato and Subaru the most, and I thought that Kanato sometimes just, pretty creepy was...

What I have to say is that, when you think one of them is kind, you're mistaken, none of them is really kind, but I think they have something inside them, somewhere that is nice (you can see it a bit in Ayato and Subaru, maybe that's why I like them). And, for some of them, you can also see that their past has a bit of influence in their life, how they became.


Enjoyment 8/10

Well, enjoy? She gets bitten a lot, I don't know how much I enjoyed that (It didn't really bother, but I didn't think it was the best in the anime) but it was enough to make me keep watching. I can tell that the 'story' in this anime actually starts around episode 7 (or somewhere around that).


Overall 8/10

Maybe I should make a 7,5 of this.. It was a good one, but the ending... I expected more of it. Especially the last sentence that Yui said, I was like, really? seriously? Come on! I could have been better but maybe I was just expecting something that just wasn't there. And I wanted to know more about the characters, about their life. I thought it just needed something more.. not that I mean it was THAT bad. It's just the different kind of view from what you expect :)


I hope this review helped you so you will watch it!

Diabolik Lovers is a very controversial anime, and most people either love it or hate it. I personally loved it, although this would be better as a hentai. The storyline was really bad, and it didn't really make sense and clashed with the other events in the story. This anime is primarily for girls, especially masochistic girls with fetishes for sadistic, vampiristic, fashionable bishounens. I have to admit, the blood sucking scenes were extremely sexy. The artwork was amazing, and each character had their one fashion and theme. One thing they did do well on regarding the plot is that it wasn't a cliche romancestory. None of the characters really fall in love with her all of the sudden. The brothers stay sadistic until the end, even though there is still some character development. The opening and music was done well too. Overall, the anime was really good, not for the plot, but for the artwork and sexy scenes.

This is one of the sexiest anime I've ever seen. I'll say right away who this anime is for, and who it is not. This anime is for hard core kinky people, who like contolling dynamics. If you're totally vanilla you probably won't like this, and may even be highly offended and horrified. However, if you're the kind of person who enjoys Master/slave dynamics, and stories like The Story of O, you will probably really like this.
The anime itself is an interesting take on the harem genre. Instead of the usual male protagonist, surrounded by girls, here you have a single girl, surrounded by predatorymale vampire brothers, all whom are competing somewhat sadistically to make her their lunch.


She's basically made into their slave, and as the plot unfolds, we get to find out why she is there, and what her connection is to all of this. If you like hardcore unequal power dynamics, this will really appeal to you. If you like guys who are jerks and who push you around, this will probably make you weak in the knees and a puddly little mess. And if you enjoy girls being helpless little slaves, you will really like this.


Definitely hard core as far as the plot is concerned. They push her around and take what they want from her. If you like that sort of thing, you will really like this. If that sort of thing horrifies you, or freaks you out, or offends you, you definitely should not watch this, as it will probably seem very disturbing to you.

Okay so I'm just going to give it to you straight; this anime is the absolute worst. There is no story plot until episodes 10-12, which is ridiculous, since there is only 12 episodes in the first season. I watched this anime dubbed, and the voices were obnoxious. Yui's voice kind of makes me want to stab myself in the face, with a fork. 
I don't even want to mention all the moaning that happens in this anime; like seriously, I thought I was watching hentai for a moment. I kid you not, every time on of the vampires went to suck Yui's blood, shemoaned like there was no tomorrow, and they made weird uncomfortable sucking noises. And don't even get me started on the music quality. Whenever music played, it was so loud you couldn't hear what anyone was saying. 



Now, if you are interested in a anime that has abusive men all attracted to one girl, and the only thing that remotely makes it better (and yet still doesn't) is the fact that they are vampires, then this is the anime for you! Seriously, every episode there are at least 4 vampires sucking her blood. I don't know how she is not anemic by the second episode. Seriously. Not to mention the vampire anime cliche, 'the protagonist has delicious blood' which makes me want to hurt myself every time. 



Anything else I should add? Oh yeah! Ever heard of Vampire Knight? It's decent right? Have you ever seen the dubbed version? If not, then you won't understand the point I'm about to make: Yui's voice is even more annoying then that of the main girl in Vampire Knight. And her voice was bloody awful. 



Sorry for the review being so long. I hope this helps anyone. I wouldn't say that I absolutely hated the anime, but I definitely won't be watching it again anytime soon.

Story: 3

Art: 8

Sound: 8

Characters: 3

Enjoyment: 2

Overall: 2

The only major drawback to this series is the fact that the intended audience is rather small. The original Drama CDs (which inspired the visual novel then this) were targeted towards masochistic women in Japan. Now, keeping that in mind while watching the series, it definitely explains the 'rape-y' vibe (which I have noticed appears in more than a few of the reviews, despite no actual sexual intercourse in the slightest). So be weary when you go to watch the show; If you're not part of that select group of people then this is most certainly not the show for you. Moving on wards, theart choice for the series as well as the animation are both absolutely stunning and are, at the very least, worth checking out even if you're not into the show or concept. The overall story for the season was honestly drawn out and there wasn't much of it in the beginning episodes, however, it started to pick up towards the middle and end it made it somewhat worth it. The characters on the other end were all sadistic (which makes sense given the target audience) however, they were all sadistic in very similar ways and between them there wasn't much variety (with the exception of a few instances, but I digress).

Diabolik lovers offers almost everything you expect from a good vampire anime. But first I will go report it, what it's all about in Diabolik Lovers since. The protagonist Yui Komori is sent by her father to the Sakamakis. These have a large estate, where Yui is sent by her driver. With their luggage in hand, she goes to the front door, where a large door knocker is. But nobody responds as to her knock, they just want to knock again, when suddenly the door swings open of its own accord. Somewhat surprised she enters, looking for a person. When she umguckt located in theentrance hall, she suddenly sees a young man with red hair lying on the sofa. She speaks to him, but he does not respond. Fearing she feels his pulse and his heart, but it does not stop his heart. You just want to call with your cell phone an ambulance, because it is her torn suddenly from the boy out of his hand. Full aghast she is surprised by the young vampire and almost bitten, but suddenly appears another boy on. He has gray hair and looks older. Yui recognize their chance and runs up to him and begs him to help her. He asks what she has lost at all here. Then he rounds up his brothers and clear them all. Finally comes herraus that Yui henceforth shall dwell with the Sakamakis. I particularly liked the story and the characters, there was nothing wrong. All in one: A very good vampire anime!

When an anime is based on a Visual Novel it's very hard to put all of the different routes into one anime. Normally, when an anime is based off a Visual Novel they tend to be lacking what other anime have due to limitations on the story or they just end out being plain bad. It is extremely hard to portray the character's personalities and emotions when it's based off such a limited resource. Because these types of anime are so hard to pull off, there are rare circumstances where if it's done correctly, the anime will be extremely satisfying. Unfortunately, with Diabolik Lovers, thiswasn't the case.


Story: 3 

For some unknown reason, I feel bad giving Diabolik Lovers' story a rank of poor. Throughout the anime, I kept giving it chances to get better and so I kept watching. Sadly, it didn't. For me, the story would've been a lot better if they went about it in a different way. I feel that I kept giving it some slack because it was based off a Visual Novel but now that I've finished both the OVA and the anime, I am forced to give Diabolik Lovers a bad review.

Without spoiling anything, the story is about a girl who moves into a new home after being sent there by her Father. Little did she know that this rather large mansion was a home to vampires craving fresh blood. The six vampires that she's now living with want to claim her as theirs. They abuse her like a slave, they don't treat her as a person and they take her blood whenever they desire. Really, she's just a poor sacrifice. Because of certain reasons, she cannot leave the home. I cannot write much more incase you do indeed wish to watch this anime but I can say for sure that the story isn't good. Although I rant about the story, I can't say that I didn't enjoy it a little.


Art: 7

The art could be better. For the type of anime it is, the shoujo art style was a good choice. I would've given it a higher rank if it wasn't for the fact that some of the backgrounds look like they've been taken out of a book and pasted into the anime. I am not sure as to weather or not this was intended but for me, this sometimes became an eye sore. Other than that, the art was average for the time that Diabolik Lovers aired. 


Sound: 6

No soundtrack really stood out to me in Diabolik Lovers. Because of this reason, I gave it a fair score. The sound wasn't bad, but it wasn't striking either. The only problem with the sound that I had was the blood sucking sound effects and the ending song. Much dramatic ending. Such wow.

I'm not even joking, it's just dramatic battle-like music with credits.

(╯°□°）╯︵ ┻━┻ I can't even...


Character: 6

The character development was fair. It wasn't good enough to get me overly attached like most anime (because I am a typical fangirl) but at the same time I was attached to them in some way. I would've definitely cried if one of them were to die. The problem with this anime is the problem that most reverse harem anime have: too many characters to develop. This anime focuses on the characters around the female protagonist (Yui) like it should since Yui has no real importance. But, since there are over six characters surrounding Yui and such short episodes, they have to equal out the development. In these types of anime, if one character is more developed than the other, they're most likely going to get the female in the end and so, reverse harem makers watch out for this. I had no real problems with the characters if you exclude the occasional rude tongue. For this reason alone, I wont give the characters a poor rank. 

They could've been better.


Enjoyment: 3 

I found this anime quite insulting at some times so that took out some enjoyment for me. The ending was a bit too dramatic for me and I found myself having to force myself to finish the last few episodes. At times I did enjoy the anime but at others I didn't.


Overall: 3

Diabolik Lovers was a bad anime. Some could argue with me but in the end of the day, this type of anime, as I've said before is extremely hard to pull off. The stupid story combined with the overly dramatic situations made this anime seem worse than it was. Diabolik Lovers wasn't entirely bad, but it wasn't good. I myself wouldn't recommend Diabolik Lovers to everyone but if you're into vampires and abuse then go ahead.

ok I felt a review should be written by someone who actually likes this anime.  Its another one of those otomate games adapted into an anime.  12 roughly 15m long episodes.  
I think where all the negatively and let downs are coming from are really due to expectations in the wrong direction. if you take a step back it originated from a dating game. a dating game that put the player into a harlem.  much like real life dating; people have different taste in their relationships.  this is directed at the individuals that enjoy masochism.  
with that laid outthe anime served its purpose. it gave masochistic anime fan girls/boys a sequel and was entertaining.  \n
The story line was decent a bit floppy, but there weren't holes.  the animation was stunning, with a nice steam punk/visual kei/ Victorian look. movement wasn't awkward, picture frames were consistent. I quite enjoyed the sound, the voices actors were perfect along with the other background noises.  There was character development not a lot but it was there, a lot of good strong character in attitude and appearance, all the typical lover boy types were thrown in ie. lazy, smart, shota, self-loathing, and the egotistical in your face.\n
overall if youre not into masochism youre not going to enjoy this anime, you'll probably be repulsed.  on the flip side if you do, you'll quite enjoy it, and carry on (:

Okay, so here's the warning for this anime. There are 2 sides; you either LOVE it, or you hate it. 
Most of the other reviews depict this as an immoral and sick anime, but if reverse harem and sadists are you thing, then you'll enjoy this thoroughly. 
Story (6/10): Not the best story, but the flash backs are pretty interesting as you move on later in the anime. Basically, this girl's father goes overseas so she's sent to live with her "distant relatives" who are vampires. She has to fit to their schedule and attends night school. Literally each vampire gets their turn to suckher blood, but she still cares about them in the next episode (I don't even know... she's stupid) \n
Art (10/10): I don't know how else to say this but the art is really beautiful. The characters are well-drawn and the background is very spooky and fits the anime well.\n
Sound (9/10): I really like the soundtrack and voice acting for this anime. The intro song is really spooky and eerie, which suits well with the plot and concept off the anime, and the voices sound as the characters looks (innocent, arrogant, strict, etc.)\n
Character (9/10): I rated this as a 9 because really, the characters fit the concept of this anime. The vampires are sadists because something horrible happened in their past, it's understandable. But what I find unsual is that the girl is so freaking stupid. Even if she's a girl, it's not like can't comprehend who is a bad guy...\n
Enjoyment (8/10): I enjoyed this anime. It is something like a drama/ecchi/thriller so if you're into those then you should watch it.\n
Overall (9/10): this anime, despite the bad reviews has its good qualities as well. But anything, whether its anime, movies, or dramas, people really have different opinions. You shouldn't always rely on reviews to interpret whether something is good or not. So basically, you really just have to watch this anime yourself ^-^\n

After hearing about this anime from a YouTuber I like (The Anime Man), I went into this thinking "How bad could it be?". The answer became very clearly within 15 minutes (a.k.a the first episode).
I was immediately greeted by the main female protagonist (Yui), who soon became more hated than Bella Swan in my mind, with her whiny and irritating personality, and her persistence in running away, falling over, and turning her neck to the brothers to drink from her, regardless that she is 'trying to resist'. 
Then along came the immortal brothers who drove the storyline of draining Yui's blood, all limited in theirrange of emotions  yet endless in their creepiness. I was so glad that each episode was 15 minutes long, as I could get it all over and done with as soon as possible.\n\n
Though the characters made the storyline (or lack of storyline) close to insufferable, one of my key motivations to keep watching was to see if/when Yui dies. Hopefully I'll be luckier with the second season, due to my slight interest on how things unfolded in the last episode.

I watched it all in one day non-stop cos it was actually pretty captivating but the ending was a bitof a let down cos it most DEFINITELY doesn't go through everything, I still wanna know what happens to Saburo's mother and who Yui ends up with.


TBH though, this is the sort of anime should only be viewed if you have the creative sorta mind that don't mind unfulfilled endings and have the capacity to move on or make up your own ending.

Did you know that this show was getting another season? I didn't. I mean, I read on MAL that there was a 'sequel' show to Diabolik Lovers entitled 'Diabolik Lovers More,Blood', but I didn't believe what I was looking at (the comma in your second season title is one word too late by the way fellas). I went back to the page multiple times, and eventually realised 'oh, this actually exists.' The fact that a show this atrocious can get a sequel clearly demonstrates how pathetic this industry is, and that really hurts me to say. Now that I check again, apparently it's already startedairing and has finished! Bloody hell. Anyway, let's tackle this beast of a show... and I don't say that in a good way. 


Alright, well, this is probably one of the worst shows I've ever watched; just thought I'd get that out there immediately in case you didn't know my view on this. I'm very pleased that everyone else seems to realise how poor this show's quality is, otherwise I'd probably have to press the eject button on my 'anime fan' seat and get out of this community as fast as possible. 


What drew me to this show initially was the art, which is what usually gets me watching a show in the first place. The art of this show is surprisingly (given how horrendous everything else is), very good; phenomenal in fact. I was particularly drawn to the eye design of the characters, which is something I can always appreciate when it comes to anime art. 


Even the concept of the show, 'a family of attractive vampiric brothers sharing a living space with a young girl', was something that took my interest. I wasn't sure what to expect, but I sure as hell wasn't expecting this blowout. 


The main character of this show, Yui Komori, despite being quite attractive, is unfortunately somewhat mentally dull. I would hazard a guess that she's missing some key thought- processes, in fact. The way in which her character interacts with the rest of the show's characters is just vacant, and very uninspiring. You feel that there is no dynamic to this girl's reactions to her surroundings, and the reason you think this is because you're dead right; she's probably the most boring character in the entire show, and that's seriously saying something. 


Diabolik Neck Biting should be the name of this show, because there are no 'lovers' present; this is merely a 'story' (I say story very loosely) about a girl running away from a group of adolescents and young men trying to bite her for sexual pleasure. While there may be a few scenes here and there giving the illusion of a 'story' existing in the show besides that of said neck biting, the actual, real 'story' is about a girl who serves no purpose in this anime other than to have her neck bitten repeatedly. I'm talking, at least 5 neck biting scenes per episode, and there can be as many as 3 or 4 different people biting her in the one episode. The entire synopsis of this show should be changed to the following: 'Girl enters house and finds herself in an endlessly repeating cycle of vampiric rape'. 


Just when you think the supposed 'story' that the show is trying its very best to tell is actually creating some kind of valid background to the whole situation, the neck biting makes a dramatic return, and reminds you why you're actually watching the show, or at the very least, the only reason why anyone would want watch the show. Who would actually want to watch it knowing how bad it is? I have no clue. I really don't think that someone with a cannibalism fetish, a blood fetish, or just a biting fetish would find this pathetic excuse of a show to be 'entertaining', or even arousing! It's difficult for me to even describe the execution of these neck biting scenes, because it feels like, as I have said, this neck biting deal is the whole entire point of this show. It gets repetitive by around episode 2/3, and this continues for the entire show. It's so pointless that it leaves me stunned for words.


There are no 'lovers' to be seen, but the quality of the show's episodes is diabolically horrendous, so I suppose the anime's name does have some relevance to what's happening in the show. I would really liken this show to your average H-Anime like so: 

H-Anime - Possesses a weak story that is not designed to interest anyone, but rather exists to create a context for the sex scenes that serve as the true purpose of the show. 

Diabolik Lovers - Possesses a weak story that is not designed to interest anyone, but rather exists to create a context for the neck biting scenes that serve as the true purpose of the show. 


Diabolik Lovers, long story short, had a much better life ahead of it in the H-Anime world. Except, this show has close to zero nudity. It fails as an H-Anime, despite having all of the prerequisites save for the show's rating, and also fails as a normal anime. Completely. I will repeat this again: 


The only positive aspect to this show is the art. Diabolik Lovers has some of my favourite anime art, yet it's one of the worst shows I have ever watched. That's a real shame, because the potential was there for something good to exist here, but it was thrown head first out the door to pander to a seemingly brain- dead demographic who value 50 neck biting scenes across 12 episodes over a legitimate story- related purpose. Fine if they're dedicated sex scenes, and the anime's rating is Rx, but not fine if it's an R - 17 anime that's not even allowed to show nudity. 


Excluding the art, this show is up there as one of the most astounding anime failures I have ever had the displeasure of watching, and quite frankly, I don't know when I'll get around to watching the second season. If it's more of the same, I'll probably drop it before the second episode, because I honestly have better things to do with my time. In fact, I think any person who has any value in their lives whatsoever would be able to find something more productive to do with their time than watching this series. 


Do not watch this show, even if you like Vampires. You will never want to watch another erotic vampiric biting scene again in your entire life, and your whole perception of what makes a vampire 'cool' will be annihilated for all eternity, if Twilight hasn't already done so. Please take yourself over to Hellsing Ultimate and give this show a miss; at least Hellsing Ultimate has a sex scene, and that was an INTERESTING show! Just forget you ever heard about Diabolik Lovers; I honestly wish I could forget.

I have been away from the anime scene for a while, wantonly losing myself in such gems as Black Sails, Vikings, and Black List. This probably was not the best choice for my return visit into the vast and imaginative world of anime. I knew what I was getting into before hand so I guess I can't really be too angry, I was just hoping that maybe it wouldn't be as bad as some have said it is.
   The animation was stunning and beautiful. The colors used served well to create a creepy and mysterious atmosphere. Each character was painstakingly drawnto have his own attitude and quite honestly was probably the only real personality these poor characters had. Suffice it say that my problem does not lie with the animation itself but with the extremely poor writing.\n\n
   The characters are extremely boring and  nauseatingly unbelievable. It felt like I was watching some weird twisted mixture of 50 Shades of Grey and Twilight. The entire anime is just a long drawn out fang rape fantasy shoddily held together by an extremely poor story-line. It constantly hints as you go that there is something more to it than what you are being given only to let you down time and time again all the way to the easily predicted ending. I would not even recommend this anime to people who just want to watch anything that might sate their fang fetish.

Alright guys and gals this anime is clearly not for children or preteens, however, its not to the tastes of every young adult out there. Most of the negativity is coming from the "mature" content. If you like a little darker anime then this is for you. The art was pleasant, very soft and easy on the eyes. It had humor,  but wasn't full of all the fluff that you normally see in this genera.( I'd watch OHSC if you wanted that) I'm a big fame of Otome games and enjoy seeing how they produced it into an anime. Honestly I'd give this animea 9 overall why, because it kept me watching... It not's 100% predictable. I'd give it a 10, but the ending left me a little disappointed. Diabolik Lovers isn't for everyone, but its interesting and has a little more depth then most reverse harems.  I'd give it a go, if you aren't sensitive.

There is a lot of misunderstanding about this anime. A lot of people call it rape and abuse, which for the original story is true. Diabolik Lovers started off as Drama CDs back in late 2011 on wards, from then the CDs continued on into an otome game and trust me for someone who has played it... It is many times more disturbing than the anime. 
Diabolik Lovers the anime was created to be an advertisement anime, to make people become interested in the games and drama CDs (which it worked for me). The anime leaves out some really valuable points from the game whichis a shame, but I couldn't help but love the anime despite that. Even though the anime is short and doesn't give one the info they're looking for, you have to admit that the way the vampires are portrayed in this is really well done. Ever since Twilight came out, people had forgotten what vampires were capable of. Sorry for the people who love the lovey dovey vampires, but this anime shows exactly how vampires should behave around humans, especially since they're all boys and they have a young, Christian girl living with them, it's only natural that they would want to break her more than they have to any other girl. With anime like this, it's best to look at the deeper picture and analyze the characters more.\n\n
But for those who weren't satisfied with the anime either way, this is a good time for you all to play the games for yourself but be warned... there is a much higher level of abuse, there is rape (off screen), minor acts of cannibalism and hints of incest, the game really isn't for the typical fangirl at all. Those who can handle such stuff should be able to play it though\n
Good Luck ^w^

Enjoyment:

Diabolic Lovers in a word (and some numbers): 2edge-y4me
This is a dark, vampire, reverse harem. Those 3 things were more than enough reason for me to want to watch this. I gave it a 10 for enjoyment because I had fun watching it with my friend and then I re-watched it with some of my family and it was just as much fun again.
Why was it fun? Well, we had a blast making fun of all the characters! The main girl Yui is the typical reverse harem, air-head, female lead.  So, naturally she has no choice, but to be annoyingly submissive and make allthe wrong decisions. The 6 vampire brothers both verbally and physically abuse her and she just takes it! She is basically livestock to these edge-y jerks. That being said, there's a lot of odd blood-sucking scenes. At one point of of them sucks blood out of her thigh! WHYYYYY??? Just do what all the mainstream vampires do and go for the neck, brah! Staph with the wanna be Edge!


All the characters are very flat with no depth to them. All the brothers are creepy in there own way (Examples: one always basks in his own glory with headphones in, one doesn't know how to roll down his pant legs, and another has a weird thing for his teddy bear), but they are all always salty and all of them think that they are "All that and a bag of chips". I couldn't pick a favorite guy because they were all jerks. 


Flat characters also made a flat story. Things happen, we see a little "sad" (not really sad) back stories for all the brothers and Yui, but all in all it was lame.


I gave the art an 8 because I liked the backgrounds, the characters' eyes, and the characters' hair, but that was pretty much the only quality from this show.


If you like Dance with Devils, this is basically the same thing.

I feel like the anime was just some kind of promotion to the visual novels. I say go play those rather than watch the anime. Prepare for a long-ass review below (or, y'know, just skip to the last two paragraphs for final thoughts.)
I'm not going to say the heroine was stupid, because it's beating a dead horse. Anime adaptions of Otomes have a propensity for having blank-slate heroines that seem slow or stupid because 1) a moderate amount of a heroine's personality (intellect included) is based on what path is taken in the game, and they just can't pick one or model herpersonality after a specific one because 2) they don't want to lean too much on one path and upset the many viewers who favored one of the other 5 (or 4; I didn't even think Kanato was an option.) So with that in mind, I don't really think anything of heroines in these types of anime because I know why they're like that. Now with that aside. 


You don't really learn anything about the individual characters except if you count vague flashbacks. They only had 15 minutes a run, but I feel like they could have done something like add an extra episode around the time Yui was living the memories, but seeing as they didn't even really try, this led back to me thinking this was just a promotional thing. Like "if you wanted to know more, you should go play that guy's path", y'know?


None of them show any sign of actually thinking of the heroine as anything more than food, which was a bit hard to watch at times. I wasn't even looking to see romance after episode 5, just for one of them to be slightly nicer or friendlier or at least not treat the heroine like a rag. I know, BDSM and all that, but I can only deal when there's ONE sadist, but there were six of them, and the girl came off more like a victim than an M. Being vampire-themed there were a LOT of sexual undertones, and the guys ganging up on her at times and treating her poorly in the end could only come of as abuse (mental and sexual) to me.


I'll admit: Subaru had me swooning for all of 2 minutes. (SPOILERS- SKIP TO "SPOILERS END" TO AVOID) He told her when to leave and gave her the knife when she didn't. But then he said what the knife was for, and I was a bit disappointed, and then I realized he wasn't really treating her like a person; it was more like setting a caged bird free. Still, I blushed at him saying "I'll make you really feel my fangs." (SPOILERS END)


The art wasn't as great as the Visual Novel, or on par for that matter. The music was kinda contemporaneously generic, thought the opening kinda stuck to me. Don't expect the characters to be nice to Yui, our heroine, (as a matter of fact, trigger warning: if you have been sexually abused, don't watch) and don't get too worked up about her stupidity (refer to paragraph 1). This anime seems to be up the ally of a lot masochistic and sadistic people so some will like it many won't it wasn't really  for me. The plot was also  pretty spotty, so if you're one of those who (allegedly) watched for plot and not for hot guys (either way I'm not judging), you'll find yourself disappointed, as I was. 


All that being said, the entire series is 180 minutes, and that's if you watch the recap episode. Might just be something to watch when you've expended all your other options. Yep. That about wraps that up.


4/10

The only reason as to why I will grant the anime a petty 2 is due the artwork - and because of their choices regarding voice actors for the characters. 
Otherwise, the serie is actually pointless to the last bit. It promotes rape, and no - you can not deny this fact. 30 seconds into the story and the main character, being the girl (Yui), is pinned underneath some creepy casanova with red hair and a huge appetite for petite women with blood inside their veins. No thank you. I get the deal; they're vampires - oh yeah, they must starve for blood. But really?This was almost exceeding my limits. It DID exceed my limits, and as a member of the female gender, it was absolutely horrendous to watch how Yui was pushed around by the several male characters. They even told Yui head-on that if she even as much as tried to escape, they would kill her. The males were complicated and downright unreasonable - disgusting.  It was painful to watch.


It may be appealing to people who may enjoy the blatant display sadism,  a horrid brother complex that will never be resolved and a sad, sad love story. As in;  VampiresxBlood. Ongoing ladyboner, excuse me. (Notice the sarcasm).

Sure, we did get a view of the character's background stories, but that didn't leave much information anyhow. It was just unfinished; too short - very grim altogether. 


I can at least tell you that I had fun watching it because of it ridiculousness. I didn't watch it myself, I admit - it was more of a erratic event for my friends and I, since we kind of ended up screeching together or laughing because of the circumstances throughout the serie. 


Absolutely pointless otherwise.

I have attempted to watch this anime twice. Both times, I have failed to get past episode 5.  This review will not be favourable to this show and likely will repeat points raised by other reviews. However my dislike for this shows means I have to have my say.
Firstly, I shall start on what I consider the shows few positive aspects.
Art: 5/10
To be fair, the animation quality is pretty good. It's not anything special but it's certainly the most appealing feature of this show. The environments certainly portray the dark, mysterious mansion well. Again it's nothing unusual for shoujo anime, but it's enjoyable enoughto look at.


Sound: 6/10

I didn't pay much attention to the overall sound design, nor did the performances generally stick with me. The voice acting is fine, although I give credits to the voice actress of the heroine. She did a great job - I just feel sorry she got stuck in this show.


Story: 1/10

Unfortunately, otome adaptions of anime are either hit-or-miss. Whilst otomes usually have branching stories, various endings or routes; anime can't replicate this. I have never had the chance to play the original otome game for Diabolick Lovers, so this is purely judging the story of the anime.


From the little of this anime I managed to survive, the story seemed like it was building up to a mystery (of sorts) about how all the characters were connected. However, this aspect kept being shoved aside in favour of the characters harassing the heroine. I wish they would bring these backstories to light sooner because the main 'plot' is virtually non-existent. Not that this anime cares about having a decent story - it needs the screen time for the heroine to be abused.


Characters: 1/10 (If I could give this 0, I would)

By episode three, I hated every character within this show. The males are flat, uninspiring and seem to consist of the worst parts of every trope imaginable. Take the typical 'edgy, cool guy' look for anime, chuck in some gradients, add the worst traits possible for a guy to have - that's this cast.


They are all selfish, lazy and scheming, and make a point of acting as derogatory towards the heroine as possible. Literally, these characters do not care if the heroine is on the verge of DEATH - as long as they get to drink blood, they just toss her around like a rag doll. They abuse the heroine (mentally and physically), insult her almost every sentence and are about as likable as a pile of mud. Even that comment is insulting to mud. These are literally the worst, most unlikable characters I have ever had the displeasure to witness. I don't care if you just like them because their 'hot' (although I fail to even see that), you should just avoid these characters. If anything, they're a good lesson on how NOT to write characters. 


The heorine, Yui, was the only reason I made it past episode one. Her design is pretty and she's likable enough at the start. She doesn't want too be there, and I felt so sorry for her. However instead of trying to change the situation or standing up for herself, she just lets it happen. Her personality doesn't evolve beyond the initial 'scared, naive, innocent victim'. Eventually I stopped feeling sorry for her and started getting irritated. 


If Yui was written so that she started to rebel against the vampires, despite being weaker than them, then I would of had a reason to keep watching. She needed to become stronger and show that she was in charge of her fate. Instead, she rolls over and lets it happen. Maybe she can change in the game? I don't know. Either way, she ends up not having no development and the audience has little reason to keep caring.


Enjoyment: 1/10

I think this review has made it pretty clear on the lack of enjoyment I had whilst viewing this show.


This is a perfect example of an otome adaption gone wrong. Not enough character is given to the heroine, and the plot is shoved aside to cram in as much 'bishie' time as possible. As a fan of otome games and romance anime, I can't recommend this show to anyone. I can't even survive one episode without hating on the characters, and despite the episodes being shorter than average, just wanted each one to hurry up and end. 


If you want a reserve harem anime with darker or supernatural elements, go and watch "Dance with Devils". If you want an otome to anime adaption done right, go and watch "Kamigami no Asobi". Avoid this anime. I feel sorry for the game's creators for having this abomination connected to their franchise.

General Plot Overview: Protagonist gets left at a house filled with vampires. All the vampires want to eat her, because she is delicious. 
A fair chunk of the story is never really explained. The more I think on it, the more giant plot holes I find. Very little is actually fully explained about anything. If you don't think on it for longer than a second it's not so awful, but once you think on it you begin asking a lot of questions that simply aren't answered or even really hinted at. 
The anime is really pretty to look at, and when Yui's blood isn't beingsucked and she's not the one talking it's actually fine to listen to. 


However, Yui as a character has absolutely no agency. Which isn't unusual for this genre (visual novels adapted to anime). In visual novels the protagonist tends to have a vanilla personality so anyone can imagine themselves in that position. As a result the dialogue is intensely stilted and unbelievable. This is something that doesn't really work in my opinion in the visual novels, and definitely doesn't work in an anime. (Here is where I note that I'm a huge fan of visual novels, but that will not stop me from pointing out that particular flaw).


The other characters are okay. As per the visual novel genre they are caricatures of actual personalities, but their very limited backstories are kind of interesting and they're just good fun in my opinion. 


If you're looking for a deep story that makes sense this is not for you.


If, however, you understand that you're getting into what amounts to a harlequin harem romance novel (complete with vampires and a damsel in distress) you'll probably enjoy the three hours you'll put into it.

Honestly, I did enjoy the anime...but it's not one of the best animes out there. 
First, you have the unoriginal horror movie plot. A girl arrives at an odd home she knows nothing about full of vampires. And, of course, they all try to suck her blood.  
Everything else seems fine. The characters and their pasts I like, but everything else isn't very well made. I'd try another anime instead of watching all 12 episodes of Diabolik Lovers, unless you're really into this.

So I decided to watch it, BIG MISTAKE.
I watched all episodes in one go, because there are only twelve of them. I thought it wouldn't hurt much, but I was wrong.
Within the first ten minutes I was a bit worried already whether this was a good idea or not. Then, two episodes later, Irealized there probably wasn't going to be much character development. 'Well, that's just too bad', I thought, but I kept watching anyway... 


Maybe it would turn out okay, who knows?


It did not get better,

it's like the people responsible for this anime got worried after a while that the viewers would get bored, so they kept adding more and more abuse to keep it interesting. Guess what? It didn't work.


So even though the story and characters did not work out, I will give it to them that the art and sound is fantastic.


If you watch anime only for the anime, of which I am guilty of myself sometimes unfortunately, you will enjoy this. If you are not, though, I will not recommend, because even I didn't like this anime, regardless of the great art style, which is the reason why I started watching anime in the first place.
